00025 /*
00026  * lustre/osd-ldiskfs/osd_scrub.c
00027  *
00028  * Top-level entry points into osd module
00029  *
00030  * The OI scrub is used for rebuilding Object Index files when restores MDT from
00031  * file-level backup.
00032  *
00033  * The otable based iterator scans ldiskfs inode table to feed up layer LFSCK.
00034  *
00035  * Author: Fan Yong <yong.fan@whamcloud.com>
00036  */
00037 
00038 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LFSCK
00039 
00040 #include <linux/kthread.h>
00041 #include <lustre/lustre_idl.h>
00042 #include <lustre_disk.h>
00043 #include <dt_object.h>
00044 #include <linux/xattr.h>
00045 
00046 #include "osd_internal.h"
00047 #include "osd_oi.h"
00048 #include "osd_scrub.h"
00049 
00050 #define HALF_SEC        msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC >> 1)
00051 
00052 #define OSD_OTABLE_MAX_HASH             0x00000000ffffffffULL
00053 
00054 #define SCRUB_NEXT_BREAK        1 /* exit current loop and process next group */
00055 #define SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE     2 /* skip current object and process next bit */
00056 #define SCRUB_NEXT_EXIT         3 /* exit all the loops */
00057 #define SCRUB_NEXT_WAIT         4 /* wait for free cache slot */
00058 #define SCRUB_NEXT_CRASH        5 /* simulate system crash during OI scrub */
00059 #define SCRUB_NEXT_FATAL        6 /* simulate failure during OI scrub */
00060 #define SCRUB_NEXT_NOSCRUB      7 /* new created object, no scrub on it */
00061 #define SCRUB_NEXT_NOLMA        8 /* the inode has no FID-in-LMA */
00062 #define SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ       9 /* for OST-object */
00063 #define SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD   10 /* old OST-object, no LMA or no FID-on-OST
00064                                     * flags in LMA */
00065

00068 static inline struct osd_device *osd_scrub2dev(struct osd_scrub *scrub)
00069 {
00070         return container_of0(scrub, struct osd_device, od_scrub);
00071 }
00072 
00073 static inline struct super_block *osd_scrub2sb(struct osd_scrub *scrub)
00074 {
00075         return osd_sb(osd_scrub2dev(scrub));
00076 }

00078 static inline int osd_scrub_has_window(struct osd_scrub *scrub,
00079                                        struct osd_otable_cache *ooc)
00080 {
00081         return scrub->os_pos_current < ooc->ooc_pos_preload + SCRUB_WINDOW_SIZE;
00082 }

00084 static inline const char *osd_scrub2name(struct osd_scrub *scrub)
00085 {
00086         return LDISKFS_SB(osd_scrub2sb(scrub))->s_es->s_volume_name;
00087 }

00096 static int osd_scrub_refresh_mapping(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00097                                      struct osd_device *dev,
00098                                      const struct lu_fid *fid,
00099                                      const struct osd_inode_id *id,
00100                                      int ops, bool force,
00101                                      enum oi_check_flags flags)
00102 {
00103         handle_t *th;
00104         int       rc;
00105         ENTRY;
00106 
00107         if (dev->od_scrub.os_file.sf_param & SP_DRYRUN && !force)
00108                 RETURN(0);
00109 
00110         /* DTO_INDEX_INSERT is enough for other two ops:
00111          * delete/update, but save stack. */
00112         th = osd_journal_start_sb(osd_sb(dev), LDISKFS_HT_MISC,
00113                                 osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_INDEX_INSERT]);
00114         if (IS_ERR(th)) {
00115                 rc = PTR_ERR(th);
00116                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to start trans for scrub op %d "
00117                        DFID" => %u/%u: rc = %d\n", osd_name(dev), ops,
00118                        PFID(fid), id->oii_ino, id->oii_gen, rc);
00119                 RETURN(rc);
00120         }
00121 
00122         switch (ops) {
00123         case DTO_INDEX_UPDATE:
00124                 rc = osd_oi_update(info, dev, fid, id, th, flags);
00125                 if (unlikely(rc == -ENOENT)) {
00126                         /* Some unlink thread may removed the OI mapping. */
00127                         rc = 1;
00128                 }
00129                 break;
00130         case DTO_INDEX_INSERT:
00131                 rc = osd_oi_insert(info, dev, fid, id, th, flags);
00132                 if (unlikely(rc == -EEXIST)) {
00133                         rc = 1;
00134                         /* XXX: There are trouble things when adding OI
00135                          *      mapping for IGIF object, which may cause
00136                          *      multiple objects to be mapped to the same
00137                          *      IGIF formatted FID. Consider the following
00138                          *      situations:
00139                          *
00140                          *      1) The MDT is upgrading from 1.8 device.
00141                          *      The OI scrub generates IGIF FID1 for the
00142                          *      OBJ1 and adds the OI mapping.
00143                          *
00144                          *      2) For some reason, the OI scrub does not
00145                          *      process all the IGIF objects completely.
00146                          *
00147                          *      3) The MDT is backuped and restored against
00148                          *      this device.
00149                          *
00150                          *      4) When the MDT mounts up, the OI scrub will
00151                          *      try to rebuild the OI files. For some IGIF
00152                          *      object, OBJ2, which was not processed by the
00153                          *      OI scrub before the backup/restore, and the
00154                          *      new generated IGIF formatted FID may be just
00155                          *      the FID1, the same as OBJ1.
00156                          *
00157                          *      Under such case, the OI scrub cannot know how
00158                          *      to generate new FID for the OBJ2.
00159                          *
00160                          *      Currently, we do nothing for that. One possible
00161                          *      solution is to generate new normal FID for the
00162                          *      conflict object.
00163                          *
00164                          *      Anyway, it is rare, only exists in theory. */
00165                 }
00166                 break;
00167         case DTO_INDEX_DELETE:
00168                 rc = osd_oi_delete(info, dev, fid, th, flags);
00169                 if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00170                         /* It is normal that the unlink thread has removed the
00171                          * OI mapping already. */
00172                         rc = 1;
00173                 }
00174                 break;
00175         default:
00176                 LASSERTF(0, "Unexpected ops %d\n", ops);
00177                 break;
00178         }
00179 
00180         ldiskfs_journal_stop(th);
00181         if (rc < 0)
00182                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to refresh OI map for scrub op %d "
00183                        DFID" => %u/%u: rc = %d\n", osd_name(dev), ops,
00184                        PFID(fid), id ? id->oii_ino : -1, id ? id->oii_gen : -1,
00185                        rc);
00186 
00187         RETURN(rc);
00188 }

00190 /* OI_scrub file ops */

00192 static void osd_scrub_file_to_cpu(struct scrub_file *des,
00193                                   struct scrub_file *src)
00194 {
00195         memcpy(des->sf_uuid, src->sf_uuid, 16);
00196         des->sf_flags   = le64_to_cpu(src->sf_flags);
00197         des->sf_magic   = le32_to_cpu(src->sf_magic);
00198         des->sf_status  = le16_to_cpu(src->sf_status);
00199         des->sf_param   = le16_to_cpu(src->sf_param);
00200         des->sf_time_last_complete      =
00201                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_time_last_complete);
00202         des->sf_time_latest_start       =
00203                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_time_latest_start);
00204         des->sf_time_last_checkpoint    =
00205                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_time_last_checkpoint);
00206         des->sf_pos_latest_start        =
00207                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_pos_latest_start);
00208         des->sf_pos_last_checkpoint     =
00209                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_pos_last_checkpoint);
00210         des->sf_pos_first_inconsistent  =
00211                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_pos_first_inconsistent);
00212         des->sf_items_checked           =
00213                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_items_checked);
00214         des->sf_items_updated           =
00215                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_items_updated);
00216         des->sf_items_failed            =
00217                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_items_failed);
00218         des->sf_items_updated_prior     =
00219                                 le64_to_cpu(src->sf_items_updated_prior);
00220         des->sf_run_time        = le32_to_cpu(src->sf_run_time);
00221         des->sf_success_count   = le32_to_cpu(src->sf_success_count);
00222         des->sf_oi_count        = le16_to_cpu(src->sf_oi_count);
00223         des->sf_internal_flags  = le16_to_cpu(src->sf_internal_flags);
00224         memcpy(des->sf_oi_bitmap, src->sf_oi_bitmap, SCRUB_OI_BITMAP_SIZE);
00225 }
00226 
00227 static void osd_scrub_file_to_le(struct scrub_file *des,
00228                                  struct scrub_file *src)
00229 {
00230         memcpy(des->sf_uuid, src->sf_uuid, 16);
00231         des->sf_flags   = cpu_to_le64(src->sf_flags);
00232         des->sf_magic   = cpu_to_le32(src->sf_magic);
00233         des->sf_status  = cpu_to_le16(src->sf_status);
00234         des->sf_param   = cpu_to_le16(src->sf_param);
00235         des->sf_time_last_complete      =
00236                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_time_last_complete);
00237         des->sf_time_latest_start       =
00238                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_time_latest_start);
00239         des->sf_time_last_checkpoint    =
00240                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_time_last_checkpoint);
00241         des->sf_pos_latest_start        =
00242                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_pos_latest_start);
00243         des->sf_pos_last_checkpoint     =
00244                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_pos_last_checkpoint);
00245         des->sf_pos_first_inconsistent  =
00246                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_pos_first_inconsistent);
00247         des->sf_items_checked           =
00248                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_items_checked);
00249         des->sf_items_updated           =
00250                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_items_updated);
00251         des->sf_items_failed            =
00252                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_items_failed);
00253         des->sf_items_updated_prior     =
00254                                 cpu_to_le64(src->sf_items_updated_prior);
00255         des->sf_run_time        = cpu_to_le32(src->sf_run_time);
00256         des->sf_success_count   = cpu_to_le32(src->sf_success_count);
00257         des->sf_oi_count        = cpu_to_le16(src->sf_oi_count);
00258         des->sf_internal_flags  = cpu_to_le16(src->sf_internal_flags);
00259         memcpy(des->sf_oi_bitmap, src->sf_oi_bitmap, SCRUB_OI_BITMAP_SIZE);
00260 }
00261 
00262 static void osd_scrub_file_init(struct osd_scrub *scrub, __u8 *uuid)
00263 {
00264         struct scrub_file *sf = &scrub->os_file;
00265 
00266         memset(sf, 0, sizeof(*sf));
00267         memcpy(sf->sf_uuid, uuid, 16);
00268         sf->sf_magic = SCRUB_MAGIC_V1;
00269         sf->sf_status = SS_INIT;
00270 }
00271 
00272 void osd_scrub_file_reset(struct osd_scrub *scrub, __u8 *uuid, __u64 flags)
00273 {
00274         struct scrub_file *sf = &scrub->os_file;
00275 
00276         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: reset OI scrub file, old flags = "
00277                LPX64", add flags = "LPX64"\n",
00278                osd_scrub2name(scrub), sf->sf_flags, flags);
00279 
00280         memcpy(sf->sf_uuid, uuid, 16);
00281         sf->sf_status = SS_INIT;
00282         sf->sf_flags |= flags;
00283         sf->sf_flags &= ~SF_AUTO;
00284         sf->sf_run_time = 0;
00285         sf->sf_time_latest_start = 0;
00286         sf->sf_time_last_checkpoint = 0;
00287         sf->sf_pos_latest_start = 0;
00288         sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint = 0;
00289         sf->sf_pos_first_inconsistent = 0;
00290         sf->sf_items_checked = 0;
00291         sf->sf_items_updated = 0;
00292         sf->sf_items_failed = 0;
00293         if (!scrub->os_in_join)
00294                 sf->sf_items_updated_prior = 0;
00295 
00296         sf->sf_items_noscrub = 0;
00297         sf->sf_items_igif = 0;
00298 }
00299 
00300 static int osd_scrub_file_load(struct osd_scrub *scrub)
00301 {
00302         loff_t  pos  = 0;
00303         int     len  = sizeof(scrub->os_file_disk);
00304         int     rc;
00305 
00306         rc = osd_ldiskfs_read(scrub->os_inode, &scrub->os_file_disk, len, &pos);
00307         if (rc == len) {
00308                 struct scrub_file *sf = &scrub->os_file;
00309 
00310                 osd_scrub_file_to_cpu(sf, &scrub->os_file_disk);
00311                 if (sf->sf_magic != SCRUB_MAGIC_V1) {
00312                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: invalid scrub magic "
00313                                "0x%x != 0x%x\n", osd_scrub2name(scrub),
00314                                sf->sf_magic, SCRUB_MAGIC_V1);
00315                         /* Process it as new scrub file. */
00316                         rc = -ENOENT;
00317                 } else {
00318                         rc = 0;
00319                 }
00320         } else if (rc != 0) {
00321                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to load scrub file, "
00322                        "expected = %d: rc = %d\n",
00323                        osd_scrub2name(scrub), len, rc);
00324                 if (rc > 0)
00325                         rc = -EFAULT;
00326         } else {
00327                 /* return -ENOENT for empty scrub file case. */
00328                 rc = -ENOENT;
00329         }
00330 
00331         return rc;
00332 }
00333 
00334 int osd_scrub_file_store(struct osd_scrub *scrub)
00335 {
00336         struct osd_device *dev;
00337         handle_t          *jh;
00338         loff_t             pos     = 0;
00339         int                len     = sizeof(scrub->os_file_disk);
00340         int                credits;
00341         int                rc;
00342 
00343         dev = container_of0(scrub, struct osd_device, od_scrub);
00344         credits = osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_WRITE_BASE] +
00345                   osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_WRITE_BLOCK];
00346         jh = osd_journal_start_sb(osd_sb(dev), LDISKFS_HT_MISC, credits);
00347         if (IS_ERR(jh)) {
00348                 rc = PTR_ERR(jh);
00349                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to start trans for scrub store: "
00350                        "rc = %d\n", osd_scrub2name(scrub), rc);
00351                 return rc;
00352         }
00353 
00354         osd_scrub_file_to_le(&scrub->os_file_disk, &scrub->os_file);
00355         rc = osd_ldiskfs_write_record(scrub->os_inode, &scrub->os_file_disk,
00356                                       len, 0, &pos, jh);
00357         ldiskfs_journal_stop(jh);
00358         if (rc != 0)
00359                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to store scrub file, "
00360                        "expected = %d: rc = %d\n",
00361                        osd_scrub2name(scrub), len, rc);
00362 
00363         scrub->os_time_last_checkpoint = cfs_time_current();
00364         scrub->os_time_next_checkpoint = scrub->os_time_last_checkpoint +
00365                                 cfs_time_seconds(SCRUB_CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL);
00366         return rc;
00367 }
00368 
00369 static int
00370 osd_scrub_convert_ff(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
00371                      struct inode *inode, const struct lu_fid *fid)
00372 {
00373         struct filter_fid_old   *ff      = &info->oti_ff;
00374         struct dentry           *dentry  = &info->oti_obj_dentry;
00375         struct lu_fid           *tfid    = &info->oti_fid;
00376         handle_t                *jh;
00377         int                      size    = 0;
00378         int                      rc;
00379         bool                     removed = false;
00380         bool                     reset   = true;
00381         ENTRY;
00382 
00383         if (dev->od_scrub.os_file.sf_param & SP_DRYRUN)
00384                 RETURN(0);
00385 
00386         if (fid_is_idif(fid) && dev->od_index_in_idif == 0) {
00387                 struct ost_id *oi = &info->oti_ostid;
00388 
00389                 fid_to_ostid(fid, oi);
00390                 ostid_to_fid(tfid, oi, 0);
00391         } else {
00392                 *tfid = *fid;
00393         }
00394 
00395         /* We want the LMA to fit into the 256-byte OST inode, so operate
00396          * as following:
00397          * 1) read old XATTR_NAME_FID and save the parent FID;
00398          * 2) delete the old XATTR_NAME_FID;
00399          * 3) make new LMA and add it;
00400          * 4) generate new XATTR_NAME_FID with the saved parent FID and add it.
00401          *
00402          * Making the LMA to fit into the 256-byte OST inode can save time for
00403          * normal osd_check_lma() and for other OI scrub scanning in future.
00404          * So it is worth to make some slow conversion here. */
00405         jh = osd_journal_start_sb(osd_sb(dev), LDISKFS_HT_MISC,
00406                                 osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_XATTR_SET] * 3);
00407         if (IS_ERR(jh)) {
00408                 rc = PTR_ERR(jh);
00409                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to start trans for convert ff "
00410                        DFID": rc = %d\n", osd_name(dev), PFID(tfid), rc);
00411                 RETURN(rc);
00412         }
00413 
00414         /* 1) read old XATTR_NAME_FID and save the parent FID */
00415         rc = __osd_xattr_get(inode, dentry, XATTR_NAME_FID, ff, sizeof(*ff));
00416         if (rc == sizeof(*ff)) {
00417                 /* 2) delete the old XATTR_NAME_FID */
00418                 ll_vfs_dq_init(inode);
00419                 rc = inode->i_op->removexattr(dentry, XATTR_NAME_FID);
00420                 if (rc != 0)
00421                         GOTO(stop, rc);
00422 
00423                 removed = true;
00424         } else if (unlikely(rc == -ENODATA)) {
00425                 reset = false;
00426         } else if (rc != sizeof(struct filter_fid)) {
00427                 GOTO(stop, rc = -EINVAL);
00428         }
00429 
00430         /* 3) make new LMA and add it */
00431         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, tfid, LMAC_FID_ON_OST, 0);
00432         if (rc == 0 && reset)
00433                 size = sizeof(struct filter_fid);
00434         else if (rc != 0 && removed)
00435                 /* If failed, we should try to add the old back. */
00436                 size = sizeof(struct filter_fid_old);
00437 
00438         /* 4) generate new XATTR_NAME_FID with the saved parent FID and add it*/
00439         if (size > 0) {
00440                 int rc1;
00441 
00442                 rc1 = __osd_xattr_set(info, inode, XATTR_NAME_FID, ff, size,
00443                                       XATTR_CREATE);
00444                 if (rc1 != 0 && rc == 0)
00445                         rc = rc1;
00446         }
00447 
00448         GOTO(stop, rc);
00449 
00450 stop:
00451         ldiskfs_journal_stop(jh);
00452         if (rc < 0)
00453                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to convert ff "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00454                        osd_name(dev), PFID(tfid), rc);
00455         return rc;
00456 }
00457 
00458 static int
00459 osd_scrub_check_update(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
00460                        struct osd_idmap_cache *oic, int val)
00461 {
00462         struct osd_scrub             *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
00463         struct scrub_file            *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
00464         struct lu_fid                *fid    = &oic->oic_fid;
00465         struct osd_inode_id          *lid    = &oic->oic_lid;
00466         struct osd_inode_id          *lid2   = &info->oti_id;
00467         struct osd_inconsistent_item *oii    = NULL;
00468         struct inode                 *inode  = NULL;
00469         int                           ops    = DTO_INDEX_UPDATE;
00470         int                           idx;
00471         int                           rc;
00472         bool                          converted = false;
00473         ENTRY;
00474 
00475         down_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00476         scrub->os_new_checked++;
00477         if (val < 0)
00478                 GOTO(out, rc = val);
00479 
00480         if (scrub->os_in_prior)
00481                 oii = list_entry(oic, struct osd_inconsistent_item,
00482                                  oii_cache);
00483 
00484         if (lid->oii_ino < sf->sf_pos_latest_start && oii == NULL)
00485                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00486 
00487         if (fid_is_igif(fid))
00488                 sf->sf_items_igif++;
00489 
00490         if (val == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD) {
00491                 inode = osd_iget(info, dev, lid);
00492                 if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00493                         rc = PTR_ERR(inode);
00494                         /* Someone removed the inode. */
00495                         if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ESTALE)
00496                                 rc = 0;
00497                         GOTO(out, rc);
00498                 }
00499 
00500                 /* The inode has been reused as EA inode, ignore it. */
00501                 if (unlikely(osd_is_ea_inode(inode)))
00502                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00503 
00504                 sf->sf_flags |= SF_UPGRADE;
00505                 sf->sf_internal_flags &= ~SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID;
00506                 dev->od_check_ff = 1;
00507                 rc = osd_scrub_convert_ff(info, dev, inode, fid);
00508                 if (rc != 0)
00509                         GOTO(out, rc);
00510 
00511                 converted = true;
00512         }
00513 
00514         if ((val == SCRUB_NEXT_NOLMA) &&
00515             (!scrub->os_convert_igif || OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_FID_NOLMA)))
00516                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00517 
00518         if ((oii != NULL && oii->oii_insert) || (val == SCRUB_NEXT_NOLMA)) {
00519                 ops = DTO_INDEX_INSERT;
00520 
00521                 goto iget;
00522         }
00523 
00524         rc = osd_oi_lookup(info, dev, fid, lid2,
00525                 (val == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ ||
00526                  val == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD) ? OI_KNOWN_ON_OST : 0);
00527         if (rc != 0) {
00528                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
00529                         ops = DTO_INDEX_INSERT;
00530                 else if (rc != -ESTALE)
00531                         GOTO(out, rc);
00532 
00533 iget:
00534                 if (inode == NULL) {
00535                         inode = osd_iget(info, dev, lid);
00536                         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00537                                 rc = PTR_ERR(inode);
00538                                 /* Someone removed the inode. */
00539                                 if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ESTALE)
00540                                         rc = 0;
00541                                 GOTO(out, rc);
00542                         }
00543 
00544                         /* The inode has been reused as EA inode, ignore it. */
00545                         if (unlikely(osd_is_ea_inode(inode)))
00546                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00547                 }
00548 
00549                 if (!scrub->os_partial_scan)
00550                         scrub->os_full_speed = 1;
00551 
00552                 idx = osd_oi_fid2idx(dev, fid);
00553                 switch (val) {
00554                 case SCRUB_NEXT_NOLMA:
00555                         sf->sf_flags |= SF_UPGRADE;
00556                         if (!(sf->sf_param & SP_DRYRUN)) {
00557                                 rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid, 0, 0);
00558                                 if (rc != 0)
00559                                         GOTO(out, rc);
00560                         }
00561 
00562                         if (!(sf->sf_flags & SF_INCONSISTENT))
00563                                 dev->od_igif_inoi = 0;
00564                         break;
00565                 case SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ:
00566                         sf->sf_flags |= SF_INCONSISTENT;
00567                 case SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD:
00568                         break;
00569                 default:
00570                         sf->sf_flags |= SF_RECREATED;
00571                         if (unlikely(!ldiskfs_test_bit(idx, sf->sf_oi_bitmap)))
00572                                 ldiskfs_set_bit(idx, sf->sf_oi_bitmap);
00573                         break;
00574                 }
00575         } else if (osd_id_eq(lid, lid2)) {
00576                 if (converted)
00577                         sf->sf_items_updated++;
00578 
00579                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00580         } else {
00581                 if (!scrub->os_partial_scan)
00582                         scrub->os_full_speed = 1;
00583 
00584                 sf->sf_flags |= SF_INCONSISTENT;
00585 
00586                 /* XXX: If the device is restored from file-level backup, then
00587                  *      some IGIFs may have been already in OI files, and some
00588                  *      may be not yet. Means upgrading from 1.8 may be partly
00589                  *      processed, but some clients may hold some immobilized
00590                  *      IGIFs, and use them to access related objects. Under
00591                  *      such case, OSD does not know whether an given IGIF has
00592                  *      been processed or to be processed, and it also cannot
00593                  *      generate local ino#/gen# directly from the immobilized
00594                  *      IGIF because of the backup/restore. Then force OSD to
00595                  *      lookup the given IGIF in OI files, and if no entry,
00596                  *      then ask the client to retry after upgrading completed.
00597                  *      No better choice. */
00598                 dev->od_igif_inoi = 1;
00599         }
00600 
00601         rc = osd_scrub_refresh_mapping(info, dev, fid, lid, ops, false,
00602                         (val == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ ||
00603                          val == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD) ? OI_KNOWN_ON_OST : 0);
00604         if (rc == 0) {
00605                 if (scrub->os_in_prior)
00606                         sf->sf_items_updated_prior++;
00607                 else
00608                         sf->sf_items_updated++;
00609         }
00610 
00611         GOTO(out, rc);
00612 
00613 out:
00614         if (rc < 0) {
00615                 sf->sf_items_failed++;
00616                 if (sf->sf_pos_first_inconsistent == 0 ||
00617                     sf->sf_pos_first_inconsistent > lid->oii_ino)
00618                         sf->sf_pos_first_inconsistent = lid->oii_ino;
00619         } else {
00620                 rc = 0;
00621         }
00622 
00623         /* There may be conflict unlink during the OI scrub,
00624          * if happend, then remove the new added OI mapping. */
00625         if (ops == DTO_INDEX_INSERT && inode != NULL && !IS_ERR(inode) &&
00626             unlikely(ldiskfs_test_inode_state(inode,
00627                                               LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_DESTROY)))
00628                 osd_scrub_refresh_mapping(info, dev, fid, lid,
00629                                 DTO_INDEX_DELETE, false,
00630                                 (val == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ ||
00631                                  val == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD) ?
00632                                 OI_KNOWN_ON_OST : 0);
00633         up_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00634 
00635         if (inode != NULL && !IS_ERR(inode))
00636                 iput(inode);
00637 
00638         if (oii != NULL) {
00639                 LASSERT(list_empty(&oii->oii_list));
00640 
00641                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oii);
00642         }
00643 
00644         RETURN(sf->sf_param & SP_FAILOUT ? rc : 0);
00645 }
00646 
00647 /* OI scrub APIs */
00648 
00649 static int osd_scrub_prep(struct osd_device *dev)
00650 {
00651         struct osd_scrub     *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
00652         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
00653         struct scrub_file    *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
00654         __u32                 flags  = scrub->os_start_flags;
00655         int                   rc;
00656         bool                  drop_dryrun = false;
00657         ENTRY;
00658 
00659         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: OI scrub prep, flags = 0x%x\n",
00660                osd_scrub2name(scrub), flags);
00661 
00662         down_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00663         if (flags & SS_SET_FAILOUT)
00664                 sf->sf_param |= SP_FAILOUT;
00665         else if (flags & SS_CLEAR_FAILOUT)
00666                 sf->sf_param &= ~SP_FAILOUT;
00667 
00668         if (flags & SS_SET_DRYRUN) {
00669                 sf->sf_param |= SP_DRYRUN;
00670         } else if (flags & SS_CLEAR_DRYRUN && sf->sf_param & SP_DRYRUN) {
00671                 sf->sf_param &= ~SP_DRYRUN;
00672                 drop_dryrun = true;
00673         }
00674 
00675         if (flags & SS_RESET)
00676                 osd_scrub_file_reset(scrub,
00677                         LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(dev))->s_es->s_uuid, 0);
00678 
00679         if (flags & SS_AUTO_FULL) {
00680                 scrub->os_full_speed = 1;
00681                 scrub->os_partial_scan = 0;
00682                 sf->sf_flags |= SF_AUTO;
00683         } else if (flags & SS_AUTO_PARTIAL) {
00684                 scrub->os_full_speed = 0;
00685                 scrub->os_partial_scan = 1;
00686                 sf->sf_flags |= SF_AUTO;
00687         } else if (sf->sf_flags & (SF_RECREATED | SF_INCONSISTENT |
00688                                    SF_UPGRADE)) {
00689                 scrub->os_full_speed = 1;
00690                 scrub->os_partial_scan = 0;
00691         } else {
00692                 scrub->os_full_speed = 0;
00693                 scrub->os_partial_scan = 0;
00694         }
00695 
00696         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
00697         scrub->os_in_prior = 0;
00698         scrub->os_waiting = 0;
00699         scrub->os_paused = 0;
00700         scrub->os_in_join = 0;
00701         scrub->os_full_scrub = 0;
00702         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
00703         scrub->os_new_checked = 0;
00704         if (drop_dryrun && sf->sf_pos_first_inconsistent != 0)
00705                 sf->sf_pos_latest_start = sf->sf_pos_first_inconsistent;
00706         else if (sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint != 0)
00707                 sf->sf_pos_latest_start = sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint + 1;
00708         else
00709                 sf->sf_pos_latest_start = LDISKFS_FIRST_INO(osd_sb(dev)) + 1;
00710 
00711         scrub->os_pos_current = sf->sf_pos_latest_start;
00712         sf->sf_status = SS_SCANNING;
00713         sf->sf_time_latest_start = cfs_time_current_sec();
00714         sf->sf_time_last_checkpoint = sf->sf_time_latest_start;
00715         sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint = sf->sf_pos_latest_start - 1;
00716         rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
00717         if (rc == 0) {
00718                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
00719                 thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_RUNNING);
00720                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
00721                 wake_up_all(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00722         }
00723         up_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00724 
00725         RETURN(rc);
00726 }
00727 
00728 static int osd_scrub_checkpoint(struct osd_scrub *scrub)
00729 {
00730         struct scrub_file *sf = &scrub->os_file;
00731         int                rc;
00732 
00733         if (likely(cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(),
00734                                    scrub->os_time_next_checkpoint) ||
00735                    scrub->os_new_checked == 0))
00736                 return 0;
00737 
00738         down_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00739         sf->sf_items_checked += scrub->os_new_checked;
00740         scrub->os_new_checked = 0;
00741         sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint = scrub->os_pos_current;
00742         sf->sf_time_last_checkpoint = cfs_time_current_sec();
00743         sf->sf_run_time += cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_current() + HALF_SEC -
00744                                             scrub->os_time_last_checkpoint);
00745         rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
00746         up_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00747 
00748         return rc;
00749 }
00750 
00751 static int osd_scrub_post(struct osd_scrub *scrub, int result)
00752 {
00753         struct scrub_file *sf = &scrub->os_file;
00754         int rc;
00755         ENTRY;
00756 
00757         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: OI scrub post, result = %d\n",
00758                osd_scrub2name(scrub), result);
00759 
00760         down_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00761         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
00762         thread_set_flags(&scrub->os_thread, SVC_STOPPING);
00763         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
00764         if (scrub->os_new_checked > 0) {
00765                 sf->sf_items_checked += scrub->os_new_checked;
00766                 scrub->os_new_checked = 0;
00767                 sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint = scrub->os_pos_current;
00768         }
00769         sf->sf_time_last_checkpoint = cfs_time_current_sec();
00770         if (result > 0) {
00771                 struct osd_device *dev =
00772                         container_of0(scrub, struct osd_device, od_scrub);
00773 
00774                 dev->od_igif_inoi = 1;
00775                 dev->od_check_ff = 0;
00776                 sf->sf_status = SS_COMPLETED;
00777                 if (!(sf->sf_param & SP_DRYRUN)) {
00778                         memset(sf->sf_oi_bitmap, 0, SCRUB_OI_BITMAP_SIZE);
00779                         sf->sf_flags &= ~(SF_RECREATED | SF_INCONSISTENT |
00780                                           SF_UPGRADE | SF_AUTO);
00781                 }
00782                 sf->sf_time_last_complete = sf->sf_time_last_checkpoint;
00783                 sf->sf_success_count++;
00784         } else if (result == 0) {
00785                 if (scrub->os_paused)
00786                         sf->sf_status = SS_PAUSED;
00787                 else
00788                         sf->sf_status = SS_STOPPED;
00789         } else {
00790                 sf->sf_status = SS_FAILED;
00791         }
00792         sf->sf_run_time += cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_current() + HALF_SEC -
00793                                             scrub->os_time_last_checkpoint);
00794         rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
00795         up_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
00796 
00797         RETURN(rc < 0 ? rc : result);
00798 }
00799 
00800 /* iteration engine */
00801 
00802 struct osd_iit_param {
00803         struct super_block *sb;
00804         struct buffer_head *bitmap;
00805         ldiskfs_group_t bg;
00806         __u32 gbase;
00807         __u32 offset;
00808 };
00809 
00810 typedef int (*osd_iit_next_policy)(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00811                                    struct osd_device *dev,
00812                                    struct osd_iit_param *param,
00813                                    struct osd_idmap_cache **oic,
00814                                    const bool noslot);
00815 
00816 typedef int (*osd_iit_exec_policy)(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00817                                    struct osd_device *dev,
00818                                    struct osd_iit_param *param,
00819                                    struct osd_idmap_cache *oic,
00820                                    bool *noslot, int rc);
00821 
00822 static int osd_iit_next(struct osd_iit_param *param, __u32 *pos)
00823 {
00824         param->offset = ldiskfs_find_next_bit(param->bitmap->b_data,
00825                         LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param->sb), param->offset);
00826         if (param->offset >= LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param->sb)) {
00827                 *pos = 1 + (param->bg+1) * LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param->sb);
00828                 return SCRUB_NEXT_BREAK;
00829         } else {
00830                 *pos = param->gbase + param->offset;
00831                 return 0;
00832         }
00833 }
00834 
00839 static int osd_scrub_check_local_fldb(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00840                                       struct osd_device *dev,
00841                                       struct lu_fid *fid)
00842 {
00843         /* XXX: The initial OI scrub will scan the top level /O to generate
00844          *      a small local FLDB according to the <seq>. If the given FID
00845          *      is in the local FLDB, then it is FID-on-OST; otherwise it's
00846          *      quite possible for FID-on-MDT. */
00847         if (dev->od_is_ost)
00848                 return SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD;
00849         else
00850                 return 0;
00851 }
00852 
00853 static int osd_scrub_get_fid(struct osd_thread_info *info,
00854                              struct osd_device *dev, struct inode *inode,
00855                              struct lu_fid *fid, bool scrub)
00856 {
00857         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma     = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
00858         int                      rc;
00859         bool                     has_lma = false;
00860 
00861         rc = osd_get_lma(info, inode, &info->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
00862         if (rc == 0) {
00863                 has_lma = true;
00864                 if (lma->lma_compat & LMAC_NOT_IN_OI ||
00865                     lma->lma_incompat & LMAI_AGENT)
00866                         return SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE;
00867 
00868                 *fid = lma->lma_self_fid;
00869                 if (!scrub)
00870                         return 0;
00871 
00872                 if (lma->lma_compat & LMAC_FID_ON_OST)
00873                         return SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ;
00874 
00875                 if (fid_is_idif(fid))
00876                         return SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD;
00877 
00878                 /* For local object. */
00879                 if (fid_is_internal(fid))
00880                         return 0;
00881 
00882                 /* For external visible MDT-object with non-normal FID. */
00883                 if (fid_is_namespace_visible(fid) && !fid_is_norm(fid))
00884                         return 0;
00885 
00886                 /* For the object with normal FID, it may be MDT-object,
00887                  * or may be 2.4 OST-object, need further distinguish.
00888                  * Fall through to next section. */
00889         }
00890 
00891         if (rc == -ENODATA || rc == 0) {
00892                 rc = osd_get_idif(info, inode, &info->oti_obj_dentry, fid);
00893                 if (rc == 0) {
00894                         if (scrub)
00895                                 /* It is old 2.x (x <= 3) or 1.8 OST-object. */
00896                                 rc = SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD;
00897                         return rc;
00898                 }
00899 
00900                 if (rc > 0) {
00901                         if (!has_lma)
00902                                 /* It is FID-on-OST, but we do not know how
00903                                  * to generate its FID, ignore it directly. */
00904                                 rc = SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE;
00905                         else
00906                                 /* It is 2.4 OST-object. */
00907                                 rc = SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD;
00908                         return rc;
00909                 }
00910 
00911                 if (rc != -ENODATA)
00912                         return rc;
00913 
00914                 if (!has_lma) {
00915                         if (dev->od_scrub.os_convert_igif) {
00916                                 lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino,
00917                                               inode->i_generation);
00918                                 if (scrub)
00919                                         rc = SCRUB_NEXT_NOLMA;
00920                                 else
00921                                         rc = 0;
00922                         } else {
00923                                 /* It may be FID-on-OST, or may be FID for
00924                                  * non-MDT0, anyway, we do not know how to
00925                                  * generate its FID, ignore it directly. */
00926                                 rc = SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE;
00927                         }
00928                         return rc;
00929                 }
00930 
00931                 /* For OI scrub case only: the object has LMA but has no ff
00932                  * (or ff crashed). It may be MDT-object, may be OST-object
00933                  * with crashed ff. The last check is local FLDB. */
00934                 rc = osd_scrub_check_local_fldb(info, dev, fid);
00935         }
00936 
00937         return rc;
00938 }
00939 
00940 static int osd_iit_iget(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
00941                         struct lu_fid *fid, struct osd_inode_id *lid, __u32 pos,
00942                         struct super_block *sb, bool scrub)
00943 {
00944         struct inode *inode;
00945         int           rc;
00946         ENTRY;
00947 
00948         /* Not handle the backend root object and agent parent object.
00949          * They are neither visible to namespace nor have OI mappings. */
00950         if (unlikely(pos == osd_sb(dev)->s_root->d_inode->i_ino ||
00951                      pos == osd_remote_parent_ino(dev)))
00952                 RETURN(SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE);
00953 
00954         osd_id_gen(lid, pos, OSD_OII_NOGEN);
00955         inode = osd_iget(info, dev, lid);
00956         if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00957                 rc = PTR_ERR(inode);
00958                 /* The inode may be removed after bitmap searching, or the
00959                  * file is new created without inode initialized yet. */
00960                 if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ESTALE)
00961                         RETURN(SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE);
00962 
00963                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to read inode, ino# = %u: "
00964                        "rc = %d\n", LDISKFS_SB(sb)->s_es->s_volume_name,
00965                        pos, rc);
00966                 RETURN(rc);
00967         }
00968 
00969         /* It is an EA inode, no OI mapping for it, skip it. */
00970         if (osd_is_ea_inode(inode))
00971                 GOTO(put, rc = SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE);
00972 
00973         if (scrub &&
00974             ldiskfs_test_inode_state(inode, LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_NOSCRUB)) {
00975                 /* Only skip it for the first OI scrub accessing. */
00976                 ldiskfs_clear_inode_state(inode, LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_NOSCRUB);
00977                 GOTO(put, rc = SCRUB_NEXT_NOSCRUB);
00978         }
00979 
00980         rc = osd_scrub_get_fid(info, dev, inode, fid, scrub);
00981 
00982         GOTO(put, rc);
00983 
00984 put:
00985         iput(inode);
00986         return rc;
00987 }
00988 
00989 static int osd_scrub_next(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
00990                           struct osd_iit_param *param,
00991                           struct osd_idmap_cache **oic, const bool noslot)
00992 {
00993         struct osd_scrub     *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
00994         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
00995         struct lu_fid        *fid;
00996         struct osd_inode_id  *lid;
00997         int                   rc;
00998 
00999         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_SCRUB_DELAY) && cfs_fail_val > 0) {
01000                 struct l_wait_info lwi;
01001 
01002                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(cfs_time_seconds(cfs_fail_val), NULL, NULL);
01003                 if (likely(lwi.lwi_timeout > 0))
01004                         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01005                                 !list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items) ||
01006                                 !thread_is_running(thread),
01007                                 &lwi);
01008         }
01009 
01010         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_SCRUB_CRASH)) {
01011                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
01012                 thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPING);
01013                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01014                 return SCRUB_NEXT_CRASH;
01015         }
01016 
01017         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_SCRUB_FATAL))
01018                 return SCRUB_NEXT_FATAL;
01019 
01020         if (unlikely(!thread_is_running(thread)))
01021                 return SCRUB_NEXT_EXIT;
01022 
01023         if (!list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items)) {
01024                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
01025                 if (likely(!list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items))) {
01026                         struct osd_inconsistent_item *oii;
01027 
01028                         oii = list_entry(scrub->os_inconsistent_items.next,
01029                                 struct osd_inconsistent_item, oii_list);
01030                         list_del_init(&oii->oii_list);
01031                         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01032 
01033                         *oic = &oii->oii_cache;
01034                         scrub->os_in_prior = 1;
01035 
01036                         return 0;
01037                 }
01038                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01039         }
01040 
01041         if (noslot)
01042                 return SCRUB_NEXT_WAIT;
01043 
01044         rc = osd_iit_next(param, &scrub->os_pos_current);
01045         if (rc != 0)
01046                 return rc;
01047 
01048         *oic = &scrub->os_oic;
01049         fid = &(*oic)->oic_fid;
01050         lid = &(*oic)->oic_lid;
01051         rc = osd_iit_iget(info, dev, fid, lid,
01052                           scrub->os_pos_current, param->sb, true);
01053         return rc;
01054 }
01055 
01056 static int osd_preload_next(struct osd_thread_info *info,
01057                             struct osd_device *dev, struct osd_iit_param *param,
01058                             struct osd_idmap_cache **oic, const bool noslot)
01059 {
01060         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc    = &dev->od_otable_it->ooi_cache;
01061         struct osd_scrub        *scrub;
01062         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread;
01063         int                      rc;
01064 
01065         rc = osd_iit_next(param, &ooc->ooc_pos_preload);
01066         if (rc != 0)
01067                 return rc;
01068 
01069         scrub = &dev->od_scrub;
01070         thread = &scrub->os_thread;
01071         if (thread_is_running(thread) &&
01072             ooc->ooc_pos_preload >= scrub->os_pos_current)
01073                 return SCRUB_NEXT_EXIT;
01074 
01075         rc = osd_iit_iget(info, dev,
01076                           &ooc->ooc_cache[ooc->ooc_producer_idx].oic_fid,
01077                           &ooc->ooc_cache[ooc->ooc_producer_idx].oic_lid,
01078                           ooc->ooc_pos_preload, param->sb, false);
01079         /* If succeed, it needs to move forward; otherwise up layer LFSCK may
01080          * ignore the failure, so it still need to skip the inode next time. */
01081         ooc->ooc_pos_preload = param->gbase + ++(param->offset);
01082         return rc;
01083 }
01084 
01085 static inline int
01086 osd_scrub_wakeup(struct osd_scrub *scrub, struct osd_otable_it *it)
01087 {
01088         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
01089         if (osd_scrub_has_window(scrub, &it->ooi_cache) ||
01090             !list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items) ||
01091             it->ooi_waiting || !thread_is_running(&scrub->os_thread))
01092                 scrub->os_waiting = 0;
01093         else
01094                 scrub->os_waiting = 1;
01095         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01096 
01097         return !scrub->os_waiting;
01098 }
01099 
01100 static int osd_scrub_exec(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
01101                           struct osd_iit_param *param,
01102                           struct osd_idmap_cache *oic, bool *noslot, int rc)
01103 {
01104         struct l_wait_info       lwi    = { 0 };
01105         struct osd_scrub        *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
01106         struct scrub_file       *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
01107         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
01108         struct osd_otable_it    *it     = dev->od_otable_it;
01109         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc    = it ? &it->ooi_cache : NULL;
01110 
01111         switch (rc) {
01112         case SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE:
01113                 goto next;
01114         case SCRUB_NEXT_WAIT:
01115                 goto wait;
01116         case SCRUB_NEXT_NOSCRUB:
01117                 down_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
01118                 scrub->os_new_checked++;
01119                 sf->sf_items_noscrub++;
01120                 up_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
01121                 goto next;
01122         }
01123 
01124         rc = osd_scrub_check_update(info, dev, oic, rc);
01125         if (rc != 0) {
01126                 scrub->os_in_prior = 0;
01127                 return rc;
01128         }
01129 
01130         rc = osd_scrub_checkpoint(scrub);
01131         if (rc != 0) {
01132                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to checkpoint, pos = %u: "
01133                        "rc = %d\n", osd_scrub2name(scrub),
01134                        scrub->os_pos_current, rc);
01135                 /* Continue, as long as the scrub itself can go ahead. */
01136         }
01137 
01138         if (scrub->os_in_prior) {
01139                 scrub->os_in_prior = 0;
01140                 return 0;
01141         }
01142 
01143 next:
01144         scrub->os_pos_current = param->gbase + ++(param->offset);
01145 
01146 wait:
01147         if (it != NULL && it->ooi_waiting && ooc != NULL &&
01148             ooc->ooc_pos_preload < scrub->os_pos_current) {
01149                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
01150                 it->ooi_waiting = 0;
01151                 wake_up_all(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01152                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01153         }
01154 
01155         if (scrub->os_full_speed || rc == SCRUB_NEXT_CONTINUE)
01156                 return 0;
01157 
01158         if (ooc != NULL && osd_scrub_has_window(scrub, ooc)) {
01159                 *noslot = false;
01160                 return 0;
01161         }
01162 
01163         if (it != NULL)
01164                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq, osd_scrub_wakeup(scrub, it),
01165                              &lwi);
01166 
01167         if (ooc != NULL && osd_scrub_has_window(scrub, ooc))
01168                 *noslot = false;
01169         else
01170                 *noslot = true;
01171         return 0;
01172 }
01173 
01174 static int osd_preload_exec(struct osd_thread_info *info,
01175                             struct osd_device *dev, struct osd_iit_param *param,
01176                             struct osd_idmap_cache *oic, bool *noslot, int rc)
01177 {
01178         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc = &dev->od_otable_it->ooi_cache;
01179 
01180         if (rc == 0) {
01181                 ooc->ooc_cached_items++;
01182                 ooc->ooc_producer_idx = (ooc->ooc_producer_idx + 1) &
01183                                         ~OSD_OTABLE_IT_CACHE_MASK;
01184         }
01185         return rc > 0 ? 0 : rc;
01186 }
01187 
01188 #define SCRUB_IT_ALL    1
01189 #define SCRUB_IT_CRASH  2
01190 
01191 static void osd_scrub_join(struct osd_device *dev, __u32 flags,
01192                            bool inconsistent)
01193 {
01194         struct osd_scrub     *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
01195         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
01196         struct scrub_file    *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
01197         int                   rc;
01198         ENTRY;
01199 
01200         LASSERT(!(flags & SS_AUTO_PARTIAL));
01201 
01202         down_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
01203         scrub->os_in_join = 1;
01204         if (flags & SS_SET_FAILOUT)
01205                 sf->sf_param |= SP_FAILOUT;
01206         else if (flags & SS_CLEAR_FAILOUT)
01207                 sf->sf_param &= ~SP_FAILOUT;
01208 
01209         if (flags & SS_SET_DRYRUN)
01210                 sf->sf_param |= SP_DRYRUN;
01211         else if (flags & SS_CLEAR_DRYRUN)
01212                 sf->sf_param &= ~SP_DRYRUN;
01213 
01214         if (flags & SS_RESET) {
01215                 osd_scrub_file_reset(scrub,
01216                         LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(dev))->s_es->s_uuid,
01217                         inconsistent ? SF_INCONSISTENT : 0);
01218                 sf->sf_status = SS_SCANNING;
01219         }
01220 
01221         if (flags & SS_AUTO_FULL) {
01222                 sf->sf_flags |= SF_AUTO;
01223                 scrub->os_full_speed = 1;
01224         }
01225 
01226         if (sf->sf_flags & (SF_RECREATED | SF_INCONSISTENT | SF_UPGRADE))
01227                 scrub->os_full_speed = 1;
01228         else
01229                 scrub->os_full_speed = 0;
01230 
01231         scrub->os_new_checked = 0;
01232         if (sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint != 0)
01233                 sf->sf_pos_latest_start = sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint + 1;
01234         else
01235                 sf->sf_pos_latest_start = LDISKFS_FIRST_INO(osd_sb(dev)) + 1;
01236 
01237         scrub->os_pos_current = sf->sf_pos_latest_start;
01238         sf->sf_time_latest_start = cfs_time_current_sec();
01239         sf->sf_time_last_checkpoint = sf->sf_time_latest_start;
01240         sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint = sf->sf_pos_latest_start - 1;
01241         rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
01242         if (rc != 0)
01243                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to store scrub file when join "
01244                        "the OI scrub: rc = %d\n", osd_scrub2name(scrub), rc);
01245 
01246         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
01247         scrub->os_waiting = 0;
01248         scrub->os_paused = 0;
01249         scrub->os_partial_scan = 0;
01250         scrub->os_in_join = 0;
01251         scrub->os_full_scrub = 0;
01252         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01253         wake_up_all(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01254         up_write(&scrub->os_rwsem);
01255 
01256         EXIT;
01257 }
01258 
01259 static int osd_inode_iteration(struct osd_thread_info *info,
01260                                struct osd_device *dev, __u32 max, bool preload)
01261 {
01262         struct osd_scrub     *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
01263         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
01264         struct scrub_file    *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
01265         osd_iit_next_policy   next;
01266         osd_iit_exec_policy   exec;
01267         __u32                *pos;
01268         __u32                *count;
01269         struct osd_iit_param  param  = { NULL };
01270         struct l_wait_info    lwi    = { 0 };
01271         __u32                 limit;
01272         int                   rc;
01273         bool                  noslot = true;
01274         ENTRY;
01275 
01276         param.sb = osd_sb(dev);
01277         if (preload)
01278                 goto full;
01279 
01280         while (scrub->os_partial_scan && !scrub->os_in_join) {
01281                 struct osd_idmap_cache *oic = NULL;
01282 
01283                 rc = osd_scrub_next(info, dev, &param, &oic, noslot);
01284                 switch (rc) {
01285                 case SCRUB_NEXT_EXIT:
01286                         RETURN(0);
01287                 case SCRUB_NEXT_CRASH:
01288                         RETURN(SCRUB_IT_CRASH);
01289                 case SCRUB_NEXT_FATAL:
01290                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01291                 case SCRUB_NEXT_WAIT: {
01292                         struct kstatfs *ksfs = &info->oti_ksfs;
01293                         __u64 saved_flags;
01294 
01295                         if (dev->od_full_scrub_ratio == OFSR_NEVER ||
01296                             unlikely(sf->sf_items_updated_prior == 0))
01297                                 goto wait;
01298 
01299                         if (dev->od_full_scrub_ratio == OFSR_DIRECTLY ||
01300                             scrub->os_full_scrub) {
01301                                 osd_scrub_join(dev, SS_AUTO_FULL | SS_RESET,
01302                                                true);
01303                                 goto full;
01304                         }
01305 
01306                         rc = param.sb->s_op->statfs(param.sb->s_root, ksfs);
01307                         if (rc == 0) {
01308                                 __u64 used = ksfs->f_files - ksfs->f_ffree;
01309 
01310                                 do_div(used, sf->sf_items_updated_prior);
01311                                 /* If we hit too much inconsistent OI
01312                                  * mappings during the partial scan,
01313                                  * then scan the device completely. */
01314                                 if (used < dev->od_full_scrub_ratio) {
01315                                         osd_scrub_join(dev,
01316                                                 SS_AUTO_FULL | SS_RESET, true);
01317                                         goto full;
01318                                 }
01319                         }
01320 
01321 wait:
01322                         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_SCRUB_DELAY) &&
01323                             cfs_fail_val > 0)
01324                                 continue;
01325 
01326                         saved_flags = sf->sf_flags;
01327                         sf->sf_flags &= ~(SF_RECREATED | SF_INCONSISTENT |
01328                                           SF_UPGRADE | SF_AUTO);
01329                         sf->sf_status = SS_COMPLETED;
01330                         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01331                                      !thread_is_running(thread) ||
01332                                      !scrub->os_partial_scan ||
01333                                      scrub->os_in_join ||
01334                                      !list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items),
01335                                      &lwi);
01336                         sf->sf_flags = saved_flags;
01337                         sf->sf_status = SS_SCANNING;
01338 
01339                         if (unlikely(!thread_is_running(thread)))
01340                                 RETURN(0);
01341 
01342                         if (!scrub->os_partial_scan || scrub->os_in_join)
01343                                 goto full;
01344 
01345                         continue;
01346                 }
01347                 default:
01348                         LASSERTF(rc == 0, "rc = %d\n", rc);
01349 
01350                         osd_scrub_exec(info, dev, &param, oic, &noslot, rc);
01351                         break;
01352                 }
01353         }
01354 
01355 full:
01356         if (!preload) {
01357                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01358                              !thread_is_running(thread) || !scrub->os_in_join,
01359                              &lwi);
01360 
01361                 if (unlikely(!thread_is_running(thread)))
01362                         RETURN(0);
01363         }
01364 
01365         noslot = false;
01366         if (!preload) {
01367                 next = osd_scrub_next;
01368                 exec = osd_scrub_exec;
01369                 pos = &scrub->os_pos_current;
01370                 count = &scrub->os_new_checked;
01371         } else {
01372                 struct osd_otable_cache *ooc = &dev->od_otable_it->ooi_cache;
01373 
01374                 next = osd_preload_next;
01375                 exec = osd_preload_exec;
01376                 pos = &ooc->ooc_pos_preload;
01377                 count = &ooc->ooc_cached_items;
01378         }
01379         limit = le32_to_cpu(LDISKFS_SB(param.sb)->s_es->s_inodes_count);
01380 
01381         while (*pos <= limit && *count < max) {
01382                 struct osd_idmap_cache *oic = NULL;
01383                 struct ldiskfs_group_desc *desc;
01384 
01385                 param.bg = (*pos - 1) / LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param.sb);
01386                 desc = ldiskfs_get_group_desc(param.sb, param.bg, NULL);
01387                 if (desc == NULL)
01388                         RETURN(-EIO);
01389 
01390                 ldiskfs_lock_group(param.sb, param.bg);
01391                 if (desc->bg_flags & cpu_to_le16(LDISKFS_BG_INODE_UNINIT)) {
01392                         ldiskfs_unlock_group(param.sb, param.bg);
01393                         *pos = 1 + (param.bg + 1) *
01394                                 LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param.sb);
01395                         continue;
01396                 }
01397                 ldiskfs_unlock_group(param.sb, param.bg);
01398 
01399                 param.offset = (*pos - 1) % LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param.sb);
01400                 param.gbase = 1 + param.bg * LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param.sb);
01401                 param.bitmap = ldiskfs_read_inode_bitmap(param.sb, param.bg);
01402                 if (param.bitmap == NULL) {
01403                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: fail to read bitmap for %u, "
01404                                "scrub will stop, urgent mode\n",
01405                                osd_scrub2name(scrub), (__u32)param.bg);
01406                         RETURN(-EIO);
01407                 }
01408 
01409                 while (param.offset < LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param.sb) &&
01410                        *count < max) {
01411                         if (param.offset +
01412                                 ldiskfs_itable_unused_count(param.sb, desc) >
01413                             LDISKFS_INODES_PER_GROUP(param.sb))
01414                                 goto next_group;
01415 
01416                         rc = next(info, dev, &param, &oic, noslot);
01417                         switch (rc) {
01418                         case SCRUB_NEXT_BREAK:
01419                                 goto next_group;
01420                         case SCRUB_NEXT_EXIT:
01421                                 brelse(param.bitmap);
01422                                 RETURN(0);
01423                         case SCRUB_NEXT_CRASH:
01424                                 brelse(param.bitmap);
01425                                 RETURN(SCRUB_IT_CRASH);
01426                         case SCRUB_NEXT_FATAL:
01427                                 brelse(param.bitmap);
01428                                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01429                         }
01430 
01431                         rc = exec(info, dev, &param, oic, &noslot, rc);
01432                         if (rc != 0) {
01433                                 brelse(param.bitmap);
01434                                 RETURN(rc);
01435                         }
01436                 }
01437 
01438 next_group:
01439                 brelse(param.bitmap);
01440         }
01441 
01442         if (*pos > limit)
01443                 RETURN(SCRUB_IT_ALL);
01444         RETURN(0);
01445 }
01446 
01447 static int osd_otable_it_preload(const struct lu_env *env,
01448                                  struct osd_otable_it *it)
01449 {
01450         struct osd_device       *dev   = it->ooi_dev;
01451         struct osd_scrub        *scrub = &dev->od_scrub;
01452         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc   = &it->ooi_cache;
01453         int                      rc;
01454         ENTRY;
01455 
01456         rc = osd_inode_iteration(osd_oti_get(env), dev,
01457                                  OSD_OTABLE_IT_CACHE_SIZE, true);
01458         if (rc == SCRUB_IT_ALL)
01459                 it->ooi_all_cached = 1;
01460 
01461         if (scrub->os_waiting && osd_scrub_has_window(scrub, ooc)) {
01462                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
01463                 scrub->os_waiting = 0;
01464                 wake_up_all(&scrub->os_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
01465                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01466         }
01467 
01468         RETURN(rc < 0 ? rc : ooc->ooc_cached_items);
01469 }
01470 
01471 static int osd_scrub_main(void *args)
01472 {
01473         struct lu_env         env;
01474         struct osd_device    *dev    = (struct osd_device *)args;
01475         struct osd_scrub     *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
01476         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
01477         int                   rc;
01478         ENTRY;
01479 
01480         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_LOCAL);
01481         if (rc != 0) {
01482                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: OI scrub fail to init env: rc = %d\n",
01483                        osd_scrub2name(scrub), rc);
01484                 GOTO(noenv, rc);
01485         }
01486 
01487         rc = osd_scrub_prep(dev);
01488         if (rc != 0) {
01489                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: OI scrub fail to scrub prep: rc = %d\n",
01490                        osd_scrub2name(scrub), rc);
01491                 GOTO(out, rc);
01492         }
01493 
01494         if (!scrub->os_full_speed && !scrub->os_partial_scan) {
01495                 struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01496                 struct osd_otable_it *it = dev->od_otable_it;
01497                 struct osd_otable_cache *ooc = &it->ooi_cache;
01498 
01499                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01500                              it->ooi_user_ready || !thread_is_running(thread),
01501                              &lwi);
01502                 if (unlikely(!thread_is_running(thread)))
01503                         GOTO(post, rc = 0);
01504 
01505                 scrub->os_pos_current = ooc->ooc_pos_preload;
01506         }
01507 
01508         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: OI scrub start, flags = 0x%x, pos = %u\n",
01509                osd_scrub2name(scrub), scrub->os_start_flags,
01510                scrub->os_pos_current);
01511 
01512         rc = osd_inode_iteration(osd_oti_get(&env), dev, ~0U, false);
01513         if (unlikely(rc == SCRUB_IT_CRASH))
01514                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01515         GOTO(post, rc);
01516 
01517 post:
01518         rc = osd_scrub_post(scrub, rc);
01519         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%.16s: OI scrub: stop, pos = %u: rc = %d\n",
01520                osd_scrub2name(scrub), scrub->os_pos_current, rc);
01521 
01522 out:
01523         while (!list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items)) {
01524                 struct osd_inconsistent_item *oii;
01525 
01526                 oii = list_entry(scrub->os_inconsistent_items.next,
01527                                      struct osd_inconsistent_item, oii_list);
01528                 list_del_init(&oii->oii_list);
01529                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oii);
01530         }
01531         lu_env_fini(&env);
01532 
01533 noenv:
01534         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
01535         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
01536         wake_up_all(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01537         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
01538         return rc;
01539 }
01540 
01541 /* initial OI scrub */
01542 
01543 typedef int (*scandir_t)(struct osd_thread_info *, struct osd_device *,
01544                          struct dentry *, filldir_t filldir);
01545 
01546 #ifdef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
01547 static int osd_ios_varfid_fill(struct dir_context *buf, const char *name,
01548                                int namelen, loff_t offset, __u64 ino,
01549                                unsigned d_type);
01550 static int osd_ios_lf_fill(struct dir_context *buf, const char *name,
01551                            int namelen, loff_t offset, __u64 ino,
01552                            unsigned d_type);
01553 static int osd_ios_dl_fill(struct dir_context *buf, const char *name,
01554                            int namelen, loff_t offset, __u64 ino,
01555                            unsigned d_type);
01556 static int osd_ios_uld_fill(struct dir_context *buf, const char *name,
01557                             int namelen, loff_t offset, __u64 ino,
01558                             unsigned d_type);
01559 #else
01560 static int osd_ios_varfid_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
01561                                loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type);
01562 static int osd_ios_lf_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
01563                            loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type);
01564 static int osd_ios_dl_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
01565                            loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type);

01567                             loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type);
01568 #endif

01570 static int
01571 osd_ios_general_scan(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
01572                      struct dentry *dentry, filldir_t filldir);
01573 static int
01574 osd_ios_ROOT_scan(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
01575                   struct dentry *dentry, filldir_t filldir);

01578 osd_ios_OBJECTS_scan(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
01579                      struct dentry *dentry, filldir_t filldir);

01581 enum osd_lf_flags {
01582         OLF_SCAN_SUBITEMS       = 0x0001,
01583         OLF_HIDE_FID            = 0x0002,
01584         OLF_SHOW_NAME           = 0x0004,
01585         OLF_NO_OI               = 0x0008,
01586         OLF_IDX_IN_FID          = 0x0010,
01587 };
01588 
01589 struct osd_lf_map {
01590         char            *olm_name;
01591         struct lu_fid    olm_fid;
01592         __u16            olm_flags;
01593         __u16            olm_namelen;
01594         scandir_t        olm_scandir;
01595         filldir_t        olm_filldir;
01596 };
01597 
01598 /* Add the new introduced local files in the list in the future. */
01599 static const struct osd_lf_map osd_lf_maps[] = {
01600         /* CATALOGS */
01601         { CATLIST, { FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE, LLOG_CATALOGS_OID, 0 }, OLF_SHOW_NAME,
01602                 sizeof(CATLIST) - 1, NULL, NULL },
01603 
01604         /* CONFIGS */
01605         { MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR, { FID_SEQ_LOCAL_FILE, MGS_CONFIGS_OID, 0 },
01606                 OLF_SCAN_SUBITEMS, sizeof(MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR) - 1,
01607                 osd_ios_general_scan, osd_ios_varfid_fill },
01608 
01609         /* NIDTBL_VERSIONS */
01610         { MGS_NIDTBL_DIR, { 0, 0, 0 }, OLF_SCAN_SUBITEMS,
01611                 sizeof(MGS_NIDTBL_DIR) - 1, osd_ios_general_scan,
01612                 osd_ios_varfid_fill },
01613 
01614         /* PENDING */
01615         { "PENDING", { 0, 0, 0 }, 0, sizeof("PENDING") - 1, NULL, NULL },
01616 
01617         /* ROOT */
01618         { "ROOT", { FID_SEQ_ROOT, FID_OID_ROOT, 0 },
01619                 OLF_SCAN_SUBITEMS | OLF_HIDE_FID, sizeof("ROOT") - 1,
01620                 osd_ios_ROOT_scan, NULL },
01621 
01622         /* changelog_catalog */
01623         { CHANGELOG_CATALOG, { 0, 0, 0 }, 0, sizeof(CHANGELOG_CATALOG) - 1,
