01741 
01742 struct osd_ios_item {
01743         struct list_head oii_list;
01744         struct dentry   *oii_dentry;
01745         scandir_t        oii_scandir;
01746         filldir_t        oii_filldir;
01747 };
01748 
01749 struct osd_ios_filldir_buf {
01750 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
01751         /* please keep it as first member */
01752         struct dir_context       ctx;
01753 #endif
01754         struct osd_thread_info  *oifb_info;
01755         struct osd_device       *oifb_dev;
01756         struct dentry           *oifb_dentry;
01757 };
01758 
01759 static inline struct dentry *
01760 osd_ios_lookup_one_len(const char *name, struct dentry *parent, int namelen)
01761 {
01762         struct dentry *dentry;
01763 
01764         dentry = ll_lookup_one_len(name, parent, namelen);
01765         if (IS_ERR(dentry)) {
01766                 int rc = PTR_ERR(dentry);
01767 
01768                 if (rc != -ENOENT)
01769                         CERROR("Fail to find %.*s in %.*s (%lu/%u): rc = %d\n",
01770                                namelen, name, parent->d_name.len,
01771                                parent->d_name.name, parent->d_inode->i_ino,
01772                                parent->d_inode->i_generation, rc);
01773 
01774                 return dentry;
01775         }
01776 
01777         if (dentry->d_inode == NULL) {
01778                 dput(dentry);
01779                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
01780         }
01781 
01782         return dentry;
01783 }
01784 
01785 static int
01786 osd_ios_new_item(struct osd_device *dev, struct dentry *dentry,
01787                  scandir_t scandir, filldir_t filldir)
01788 {
01789         struct osd_ios_item *item;
01790         ENTRY;
01791 
01792         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(item);
01793         if (item == NULL)
01794                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01795 
01796         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&item->oii_list);
01797         item->oii_dentry = dget(dentry);
01798         item->oii_scandir = scandir;
01799         item->oii_filldir = filldir;
01800         list_add_tail(&item->oii_list, &dev->od_ios_list);
01801 
01802         RETURN(0);
01803 }
01804 
01812 static int
01813 osd_ios_scan_one(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
01814                  struct inode *inode, const struct lu_fid *fid, int flags)
01815 {
01816         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma    = &info->oti_mdt_attrs;
01817         struct osd_inode_id     *id     = &info->oti_id;
01818         struct osd_inode_id     *id2    = &info->oti_id2;
01819         struct osd_scrub        *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
01820         struct scrub_file       *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
01821         struct lu_fid            tfid;
01822         int                      rc;
01823         ENTRY;
01824 
01825         rc = osd_get_lma(info, inode, &info->oti_obj_dentry, lma);
01826         if (rc != 0 && rc != -ENODATA) {
01827                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to get lma for init OI scrub: "
01828                        "rc = %d\n", osd_name(dev), rc);
01829 
01830                 RETURN(rc);
01831         }
01832 
01833         osd_id_gen(id, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
01834         if (rc == -ENODATA) {
01835                 if (fid == NULL || fid_is_zero(fid) || flags & OLF_HIDE_FID) {
01836                         lu_igif_build(&tfid, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
01837                 } else {
01838                         tfid = *fid;
01839                         if (flags & OLF_IDX_IN_FID) {
01840                                 LASSERT(dev->od_index >= 0);
01841 
01842                                 tfid.f_oid = dev->od_index;
01843                         }
01844                 }
01845                 rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, &tfid, 0, 0);
01846                 if (rc != 0) {
01847                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to set LMA for init OI "
01848                               "scrub: rc = %d\n", osd_name(dev), rc);
01849 
01850                         RETURN(rc);
01851                 }
01852         } else {
01853                 if (lma->lma_compat & LMAC_NOT_IN_OI)
01854                         RETURN(0);
01855 
01856                 tfid = lma->lma_self_fid;
01857         }
01858 
01859         rc = osd_oi_lookup(info, dev, &tfid, id2, 0);
01860         if (rc != 0) {
01861                 if (rc != -ENOENT)
01862                         RETURN(rc);
01863 
01864                 rc = osd_scrub_refresh_mapping(info, dev, &tfid, id,
01865                                                DTO_INDEX_INSERT, true, 0);
01866                 if (rc > 0)
01867                         rc = 0;
01868 
01869                 RETURN(rc);
01870         }
01871 
01872         if (osd_id_eq_strict(id, id2))
01873                 RETURN(0);
01874 
01875         if (!(sf->sf_flags & SF_INCONSISTENT)) {
01876                 osd_scrub_file_reset(scrub,
01877                                      LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(dev))->s_es->s_uuid,
01878                                      SF_INCONSISTENT);
01879                 rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
01880                 if (rc != 0)
01881                         RETURN(rc);
01882         }
01883 
01884         rc = osd_scrub_refresh_mapping(info, dev, &tfid, id,
01885                                        DTO_INDEX_UPDATE, true, 0);
01886         if (rc > 0)
01887                 rc = 0;
01888 
01889         RETURN(rc);
01890 }
01891 
01896 #ifdef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
01897 static int osd_ios_lf_fill(struct dir_context *buf, const char *name,
01898                            int namelen,
01899 #else
01900 static int osd_ios_lf_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
01901 #endif
01902                            loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type)
01903 {
01904         struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *fill_buf =
01905                 (struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *)buf;
01906         struct osd_thread_info     *info     = fill_buf->oifb_info;
01907         struct osd_device          *dev      = fill_buf->oifb_dev;
01908         struct lu_fid              *fid      = &info->oti_fid;
01909         struct osd_scrub           *scrub    = &dev->od_scrub;
01910         struct dentry              *parent   = fill_buf->oifb_dentry;
01911         struct dentry              *child;
01912         struct inode               *dir      = parent->d_inode;
01913         struct inode               *inode;
01914         int                         rc;
01915         ENTRY;
01916 
01917         /* skip any '.' started names */
01918         if (name[0] == '.')
01919                 RETURN(0);
01920 
01921         scrub->os_lf_scanned++;
01922         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(name, parent, namelen);
01923         if (IS_ERR(child)) {
01924                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: cannot lookup child '%.*s': rc = %d\n",
01925                       osd_name(dev), namelen, name, (int)PTR_ERR(child));
01926                 RETURN(0);
01927         }
01928 
01929         inode = child->d_inode;
01930         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
01931                 rc = osd_ios_new_item(dev, child, osd_ios_general_scan,
01932                                       osd_ios_lf_fill);
01933                 if (rc != 0)
01934                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: cannot add child '%.*s': "
01935                               "rc = %d\n", osd_name(dev), namelen, name, rc);
01936                 GOTO(put, rc);
01937         }
01938 
01939         if (!S_ISREG(inode->i_mode))
01940                 GOTO(put, rc = 0);
01941 
01942         rc = osd_scrub_get_fid(info, dev, inode, fid, true);
01943         if (rc == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ || rc == SCRUB_NEXT_OSTOBJ_OLD) {
01944                 rc = osd_obj_map_recover(info, dev, dir, child, fid);
01945                 if (rc == 0) {
01946                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "recovered '%.*s' ["DFID"] from "
01947                                "/lost+found.\n", namelen, name, PFID(fid));
01948                         scrub->os_lf_repaired++;
01949                 } else {
01950                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: cannot rename for '%.*s' "
01951                                DFID": rc = %d\n",
01952                                osd_name(dev), namelen, name, PFID(fid), rc);
01953                 }
01954         }
01955 
01956         /* XXX: For MDT-objects, we can move them from /lost+found to namespace
01957          *      visible place, such as the /ROOT/.lustre/lost+found, then LFSCK
01958          *      can process them in furtuer. */
01959 
01960         GOTO(put, rc);
01961 
01962 put:
01963         if (rc < 0)
01964                 scrub->os_lf_failed++;
01965         dput(child);
01966         /* skip the failure to make the scanning to continue. */
01967         return 0;
01968 }
01969 
01970 #ifdef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
01971 static int osd_ios_varfid_fill(struct dir_context  *buf, const char *name,
01972                                int namelen,
01973 #else
01974 static int osd_ios_varfid_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
01975 #endif
01976                                loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type)
01977 {
01978         struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *fill_buf =
01979                 (struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *)buf;
01980         struct osd_device          *dev      = fill_buf->oifb_dev;
01981         struct dentry              *child;
01982         int                         rc;
01983         ENTRY;
01984 
01985         /* skip any '.' started names */
01986         if (name[0] == '.')
01987                 RETURN(0);
01988 
01989         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(name, fill_buf->oifb_dentry, namelen);
01990         if (IS_ERR(child))
01991                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(child));
01992 
01993         rc = osd_ios_scan_one(fill_buf->oifb_info, dev, child->d_inode,
01994                               NULL, 0);
01995         if (rc == 0 && S_ISDIR(child->d_inode->i_mode))
01996                 rc = osd_ios_new_item(dev, child, osd_ios_general_scan,
01997                                       osd_ios_varfid_fill);
01998         dput(child);
01999 
02000         RETURN(rc);
02001 }
02002 
02003 #ifdef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
02004 static int osd_ios_dl_fill(struct dir_context  *buf, const char *name,
02005                            int namelen,
02006 #else
02007 static int osd_ios_dl_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
02008 #endif
02009                            loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type)
02010 {
02011         struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *fill_buf =
02012                 (struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *)buf;
02013         struct osd_device          *dev      = fill_buf->oifb_dev;
02014         const struct osd_lf_map    *map;
02015         struct dentry              *child;
02016         int                         rc       = 0;
02017         ENTRY;
02018 
02019         /* skip any '.' started names */
02020         if (name[0] == '.')
02021                 RETURN(0);
02022 
02023         for (map = osd_dl_maps; map->olm_name != NULL; map++) {
02024                 if (map->olm_namelen != namelen)
02025                         continue;
02026 
02027                 if (strncmp(map->olm_name, name, namelen) == 0)
02028                         break;
02029         }
02030 
02031         if (map->olm_name == NULL)
02032                 RETURN(0);
02033 
02034         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(name, fill_buf->oifb_dentry, namelen);
02035         if (IS_ERR(child))
02036                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(child));
02037 
02038         rc = osd_ios_scan_one(fill_buf->oifb_info, dev, child->d_inode,
02039                               &map->olm_fid, map->olm_flags);
02040         dput(child);
02041 
02042         RETURN(rc);
02043 }
02044 
02045 #ifdef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
02046 static int osd_ios_uld_fill(struct dir_context *buf, const char *name,
02047                             int namelen,
02048 #else
02049 static int osd_ios_uld_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
02050 #endif
02051                             loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type)
02052 {
02053         struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *fill_buf =
02054                 (struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *)buf;
02055         struct dentry              *child;
02056         struct lu_fid               tfid;
02057         int                         rc       = 0;
02058         ENTRY;
02059 
02060         /* skip any non-DFID format name */
02061         if (name[0] != '[')
02062                 RETURN(0);
02063 
02064         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(name, fill_buf->oifb_dentry, namelen);
02065         if (IS_ERR(child))
02066                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(child));
02067 
02068         /* skip the start '[' */
02069         sscanf(&name[1], SFID, RFID(&tfid));
02070         if (fid_is_sane(&tfid))
02071                 rc = osd_ios_scan_one(fill_buf->oifb_info, fill_buf->oifb_dev,
02072                                       child->d_inode, &tfid, 0);
02073         else
02074                 rc = -EIO;
02075         dput(child);
02076 
02077         RETURN(rc);
02078 }
02079 
02080 #ifdef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
02081 static int osd_ios_root_fill(struct dir_context *buf, const char *name,
02082                              int namelen,
02083 #else
02084 static int osd_ios_root_fill(void *buf, const char *name, int namelen,
02085 #endif
02086                              loff_t offset, __u64 ino, unsigned d_type)
02087 {
02088         struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *fill_buf =
02089                 (struct osd_ios_filldir_buf *)buf;
02090         struct osd_device          *dev      = fill_buf->oifb_dev;
02091         const struct osd_lf_map    *map;
02092         struct dentry              *child;
02093         int                         rc       = 0;
02094         ENTRY;
02095 
02096         /* skip any '.' started names */
02097         if (name[0] == '.')
02098                 RETURN(0);
02099 
02100         for (map = osd_lf_maps; map->olm_name != NULL; map++) {
02101                 if (map->olm_namelen != namelen)
02102                         continue;
02103 
02104                 if (strncmp(map->olm_name, name, namelen) == 0)
02105                         break;
02106         }
02107 
02108         if (map->olm_name == NULL)
02109                 RETURN(0);
02110 
02111         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(name, fill_buf->oifb_dentry, namelen);
02112         if (IS_ERR(child))
02113                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(child));
02114 
02115         if (!(map->olm_flags & OLF_NO_OI))
02116                 rc = osd_ios_scan_one(fill_buf->oifb_info, dev, child->d_inode,
02117                                       &map->olm_fid, map->olm_flags);
02118         if (rc == 0 && map->olm_flags & OLF_SCAN_SUBITEMS)
02119                 rc = osd_ios_new_item(dev, child, map->olm_scandir,
02120                                       map->olm_filldir);
02121         dput(child);
02122 
02123         RETURN(rc);
02124 }
02125 
02126 static int
02127 osd_ios_general_scan(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
02128                      struct dentry *dentry, filldir_t filldir)
02129 {
02130         struct osd_ios_filldir_buf    buf   = {
02131 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
02132                                                 .ctx.actor = filldir,
02133 #endif
02134                                                 .oifb_info = info,
02135                                                 .oifb_dev = dev,
02136                                                 .oifb_dentry = dentry };
02137         struct file                  *filp  = &info->oti_file;
02138         struct inode                 *inode = dentry->d_inode;
02139         const struct file_operations *fops  = inode->i_fop;
02140         int                           rc;
02141         ENTRY;
02142 
02143         LASSERT(filldir != NULL);
02144 
02145         filp->f_pos = 0;
02146         filp->f_path.dentry = dentry;
02147         filp->f_mode = FMODE_64BITHASH;
02148         filp->f_mapping = inode->i_mapping;
02149         filp->f_op = fops;
02150         filp->private_data = NULL;
02151         set_file_inode(filp, inode);
02152 
02153 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
02154         buf.ctx.pos = filp->f_pos;
02155         rc = fops->iterate(filp, &buf.ctx);
02156         filp->f_pos = buf.ctx.pos;
02157 #else
02158         rc = fops->readdir(filp, &buf, filldir);
02159 #endif
02160         fops->release(inode, filp);
02161 
02162         RETURN(rc);
02163 }
02164 
02165 static int
02166 osd_ios_ROOT_scan(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
02167                   struct dentry *dentry, filldir_t filldir)
02168 {
02169         struct osd_scrub  *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
02170         struct scrub_file *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
02171         struct dentry     *child;
02172         int                rc;
02173         ENTRY;
02174 
02175         /* It is existing MDT0 device. We only allow the case of object without
02176          * LMA to happen on the MDT0, which is usually for old 1.8 MDT. Then we
02177          * can generate IGIF mode FID for the object and related OI mapping. If
02178          * it is on other MDTs, then becuase file-level backup/restore, related
02179          * OI mapping may be invalid already, we do not know which is the right
02180          * FID for the object. We only allow IGIF objects to reside on the MDT0.
02181          *
02182          * XXX: For the case of object on non-MDT0 device with neither LMA nor
02183          *      "fid" xattr, then something crashed. We cannot re-generate the
02184          *      FID directly, instead, the OI scrub will scan the OI structure
02185          *      and try to re-generate the LMA from the OI mapping. But if the
02186          *      OI mapping crashed or lost also, then we have to give up under
02187          *      double failure cases. */
02188         scrub->os_convert_igif = 1;
02189         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(dot_lustre_name, dentry,
02190                                        strlen(dot_lustre_name));
02191         if (IS_ERR(child)) {
02192                 rc = PTR_ERR(child);
02193                 if (rc == -ENOENT) {
02194                         /* It is 1.8 MDT device. */
02195                         if (!(sf->sf_flags & SF_UPGRADE)) {
02196                                 osd_scrub_file_reset(scrub,
02197                                         LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(dev))->s_es->s_uuid,
02198                                         SF_UPGRADE);
02199                                 sf->sf_internal_flags &= ~SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID;
02200                                 rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
02201                         } else {
02202                                 rc = 0;
02203                         }
02204                 }
02205         } else {
02206                 /* For lustre-2.x (x <= 3), the ".lustre" has NO FID-in-LMA,
02207                  * so the client will get IGIF for the ".lustre" object when
02208                  * the MDT restart.
02209                  *
02210                  * From the OI scrub view, when the MDT upgrade to Lustre-2.4,
02211                  * it does not know whether there are some old clients cached
02212                  * the ".lustre" IGIF during the upgrading. Two choices:
02213                  *
02214                  * 1) Generate IGIF-in-LMA and IGIF-in-OI for the ".lustre".
02215                  *    It will allow the old connected clients to access the
02216                  *    ".lustre" with cached IGIF. But it will cause others
02217                  *    on the MDT failed to check "fid_is_dot_lustre()".
02218                  *
02219                  * 2) Use fixed FID {FID_SEQ_DOT_LUSTRE, FID_OID_DOT_LUSTRE, 0}
02220                  *    for ".lustre" in spite of whether there are some clients
02221                  *    cached the ".lustre" IGIF or not. It enables the check
02222                  *    "fid_is_dot_lustre()" on the MDT, although it will cause
02223                  *    that the old connected clients cannot access the ".lustre"
02224                  *    with the cached IGIF.
02225                  *
02226                  * Usually, it is rare case for the old connected clients
02227                  * to access the ".lustre" with cached IGIF. So we prefer
02228                  * to the solution 2). */
02229                 rc = osd_ios_scan_one(info, dev, child->d_inode,
02230                                       &LU_DOT_LUSTRE_FID, 0);
02231                 if (rc == 0)
02232                         rc = osd_ios_new_item(dev, child, osd_ios_general_scan,
02233                                               osd_ios_dl_fill);
02234                 dput(child);
02235         }
02236 
02237         RETURN(rc);
02238 }
02239 
02240 static int
02241 osd_ios_OBJECTS_scan(struct osd_thread_info *info, struct osd_device *dev,
02242                      struct dentry *dentry, filldir_t filldir)
02243 {
02244         struct osd_scrub  *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
02245         struct scrub_file *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
02246         struct dentry     *child;
02247         int                rc;
02248         ENTRY;
02249 
02250         if (unlikely(sf->sf_internal_flags & SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID)) {
02251                 sf->sf_internal_flags &= ~SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID;
02252                 rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
02253                 if (rc != 0)
02254                         RETURN(rc);
02255         }
02256 
02257         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(ADMIN_USR, dentry, strlen(ADMIN_USR));
02258         if (!IS_ERR(child)) {
02259                 rc = osd_ios_scan_one(info, dev, child->d_inode, NULL, 0);
02260                 dput(child);
02261         } else {
02262                 rc = PTR_ERR(child);
02263         }
02264 
02265         if (rc != 0 && rc != -ENOENT)
02266                 RETURN(rc);
02267 
02268         child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(ADMIN_GRP, dentry, strlen(ADMIN_GRP));
02269         if (!IS_ERR(child)) {
02270                 rc = osd_ios_scan_one(info, dev, child->d_inode, NULL, 0);
02271                 dput(child);
02272         } else {
02273                 rc = PTR_ERR(child);
02274         }
02275 
02276         if (rc == -ENOENT)
02277                 rc = 0;
02278 
02279         RETURN(rc);
02280 }
02281 
02282 static int osd_initial_OI_scrub(struct osd_thread_info *info,
02283                                 struct osd_device *dev)
02284 {
02285         struct osd_ios_item     *item    = NULL;
02286         scandir_t                scandir = osd_ios_general_scan;
02287         filldir_t                filldir = osd_ios_root_fill;
02288         struct dentry           *dentry  = osd_sb(dev)->s_root;
02289         const struct osd_lf_map *map     = osd_lf_maps;
02290         int                      rc;
02291         ENTRY;
02292 
02293         /* Lookup IGIF in OI by force for initial OI scrub. */
02294         dev->od_igif_inoi = 1;
02295 
02296         while (1) {
02297                 rc = scandir(info, dev, dentry, filldir);
02298                 if (item != NULL) {
02299                         dput(item->oii_dentry);
02300                         OBD_FREE_PTR(item);
02301                 }
02302 
02303                 if (rc != 0)
02304                         break;
02305 
02306                 if (list_empty(&dev->od_ios_list))
02307                         break;
02308 
02309                 item = list_entry(dev->od_ios_list.next,
02310                                   struct osd_ios_item, oii_list);
02311                 list_del_init(&item->oii_list);
02312 
02313                 LASSERT(item->oii_scandir != NULL);
02314                 scandir = item->oii_scandir;
02315                 filldir = item->oii_filldir;
02316                 dentry = item->oii_dentry;
02317         }
02318 
02319         while (!list_empty(&dev->od_ios_list)) {
02320                 item = list_entry(dev->od_ios_list.next,
02321                                   struct osd_ios_item, oii_list);
02322                 list_del_init(&item->oii_list);
02323                 dput(item->oii_dentry);
02324                 OBD_FREE_PTR(item);
02325         }
02326 
02327         if (rc != 0)
02328                 RETURN(rc);
02329 
02330         /* There maybe the case that the object has been removed, but its OI
02331          * mapping is still in the OI file, such as the "CATALOGS" after MDT
02332          * file-level backup/restore. So here cleanup the stale OI mappings. */
02333         while (map->olm_name != NULL) {
02334                 struct dentry *child;
02335 
02336                 if (fid_is_zero(&map->olm_fid)) {
02337                         map++;
02338                         continue;
02339                 }
02340 
02341                 child = osd_ios_lookup_one_len(map->olm_name,
02342                                                osd_sb(dev)->s_root,
02343                                                map->olm_namelen);
02344                 if (!IS_ERR(child))
02345                         dput(child);
02346                 else if (PTR_ERR(child) == -ENOENT)
02347                         osd_scrub_refresh_mapping(info, dev, &map->olm_fid,
02348                                                   NULL, DTO_INDEX_DELETE,
02349                                                   true, 0);
02350                 map++;
02351         }
02352 
02353         RETURN(0);
02354 }
02355 
02356 char *osd_lf_fid2name(const struct lu_fid *fid)
02357 {
02358         const struct osd_lf_map *map = osd_lf_maps;
02359 
02360         while (map->olm_name != NULL) {
02361                 if (!lu_fid_eq(fid, &map->olm_fid)) {
02362                         map++;
02363                         continue;
02364                 }
02365 
02366                 if (map->olm_flags & OLF_SHOW_NAME)
02367                         return map->olm_name;
02368                 else
02369                         return "";
02370         }
02371 
02372         return NULL;
02373 }
02374 
02375 /* OI scrub start/stop */
02376 
02377 static int do_osd_scrub_start(struct osd_device *dev, __u32 flags)
02378 {
02379         struct osd_scrub     *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
02380         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
02381         struct l_wait_info    lwi    = { 0 };
02382         struct task_struct   *task;
02383         int                   rc;
02384         ENTRY;
02385 
02386         /* os_lock: sync status between stop and scrub thread */
02387         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02388 
02389 again:
02390         if (thread_is_running(thread)) {
02391                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02392                 if (!(scrub->os_file.sf_flags & SF_AUTO) ||
02393                      (flags & (SS_AUTO_FULL | SS_AUTO_PARTIAL)))
02394                         RETURN(-EALREADY);
02395 
02396                 osd_scrub_join(dev, flags, false);
02397                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02398                 if (!thread_is_running(thread))
02399                         goto again;
02400 
02401                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02402                 RETURN(0);
02403         }
02404 
02405         if (unlikely(thread_is_stopping(thread))) {
02406                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02407                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
02408                              thread_is_stopped(thread),
02409                              &lwi);
02410                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02411                 goto again;
02412         }
02413         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02414 
02415         if (scrub->os_file.sf_status == SS_COMPLETED) {
02416                 if (!(flags & SS_SET_FAILOUT))
02417                         flags |= SS_CLEAR_FAILOUT;
02418 
02419                 if (!(flags & SS_SET_DRYRUN))
02420                         flags |= SS_CLEAR_DRYRUN;
02421 
02422                 flags |= SS_RESET;
02423         }
02424 
02425         scrub->os_start_flags = flags;
02426         thread_set_flags(thread, 0);
02427         task = kthread_run(osd_scrub_main, dev, "OI_scrub");
02428         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
02429                 rc = PTR_ERR(task);
02430                 CERROR("%.16s: cannot start iteration thread: rc = %d\n",
02431                        osd_scrub2name(scrub), rc);
02432                 RETURN(rc);
02433         }
02434 
02435         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
02436                      thread_is_running(thread) || thread_is_stopped(thread),
02437                      &lwi);
02438 
02439         RETURN(0);
02440 }
02441 
02442 int osd_scrub_start(struct osd_device *dev, __u32 flags)
02443 {
02444         int rc;
02445         ENTRY;
02446 
02447         /* od_otable_mutex: prevent curcurrent start/stop */
02448         mutex_lock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02449         rc = do_osd_scrub_start(dev, flags);
02450         mutex_unlock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02451 
02452         RETURN(rc == -EALREADY ? 0 : rc);
02453 }
02454 
02455 static void do_osd_scrub_stop(struct osd_scrub *scrub)
02456 {
02457         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
02458         struct l_wait_info    lwi    = { 0 };
02459 
02460         /* os_lock: sync status between stop and scrub thread */
02461         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02462         if (!thread_is_init(thread) && !thread_is_stopped(thread)) {
02463                 thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPING);
02464                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02465                 wake_up_all(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
02466                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
02467                              thread_is_stopped(thread),
02468                              &lwi);
02469                 /* Do not skip the last lock/unlock, which can guarantee that
02470                  * the caller cannot return until the OI scrub thread exit. */
02471                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02472         }
02473         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02474 }
02475 
02476 static void osd_scrub_stop(struct osd_device *dev)
02477 {
02478         /* od_otable_mutex: prevent curcurrent start/stop */
02479         mutex_lock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02480         dev->od_scrub.os_paused = 1;
02481         do_osd_scrub_stop(&dev->od_scrub);
02482         mutex_unlock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02483 }
02484 
02485 /* OI scrub setup/cleanup */
02486 
02487 static const char osd_scrub_name[] = "OI_scrub";
02488 
02489 int osd_scrub_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *dev)
02490 {
02491         struct osd_thread_info     *info   = osd_oti_get(env);
02492         struct osd_scrub           *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
02493         struct lvfs_run_ctxt       *ctxt   = &scrub->os_ctxt;
02494         struct scrub_file          *sf     = &scrub->os_file;
02495         struct super_block         *sb     = osd_sb(dev);
02496         struct ldiskfs_super_block *es     = LDISKFS_SB(sb)->s_es;
02497         struct lvfs_run_ctxt        saved;
02498         struct file                *filp;
02499         struct inode               *inode;
02500         struct lu_fid              *fid    = &info->oti_fid;
02501         bool                        dirty  = false;
02502         bool                        restored = false;
02503         int                         rc     = 0;
02504         ENTRY;
02505 
02506         memset(scrub, 0, sizeof(*scrub));
02507         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(ctxt);
02508         ctxt->pwdmnt = dev->od_mnt;
02509         ctxt->pwd = dev->od_mnt->mnt_root;
02510         ctxt->fs = get_ds();
02511 
02512         init_waitqueue_head(&scrub->os_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
02513         init_rwsem(&scrub->os_rwsem);
02514         spin_lock_init(&scrub->os_lock);
02515         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items);
02516 
02517         push_ctxt(&saved, ctxt);
02518         filp = filp_open(osd_scrub_name, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0644);
02519         if (IS_ERR(filp)) {
02520                 pop_ctxt(&saved, ctxt);
02521                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(filp));
02522         }
02523 
02524         inode = filp->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
02525         /* 'What the @fid is' is not imporatant, because the object
02526          * has no OI mapping, and only is visible inside the OSD.*/
02527         lu_igif_build(fid, inode->i_ino, inode->i_generation);
02528         rc = osd_ea_fid_set(info, inode, fid, LMAC_NOT_IN_OI, 0);
02529         if (rc != 0) {
02530                 filp_close(filp, NULL);
02531                 pop_ctxt(&saved, ctxt);
02532                 RETURN(rc);
02533         }
02534 
02535         scrub->os_inode = igrab(inode);
02536         filp_close(filp, NULL);
02537         pop_ctxt(&saved, ctxt);
02538 
02539         rc = osd_scrub_file_load(scrub);
02540         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
02541                 osd_scrub_file_init(scrub, es->s_uuid);
02542                 /* If the "/O" dir does not exist when mount (indicated by
02543                  * osd_device::od_maybe_new), neither for the "/OI_scrub",
02544                  * then it is quite probably that the device is a new one,
02545                  * under such case, mark it as SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID.
02546                  *
02547                  * For the rare case that "/O" and "OI_scrub" both lost on
02548                  * an old device, it can be found and cleared later.
02549                  *
02550                  * For the system with "SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID", we do not
02551                  * need to check "filter_fid_old" and to convert it to
02552                  * "filter_fid" for each object, and all the IGIF should
02553                  * have their FID mapping in OI files already. */
02554                 if (dev->od_maybe_new)
02555                         sf->sf_internal_flags = SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID;
02556                 dirty = true;
02557         } else if (rc != 0) {
02558                 GOTO(cleanup_inode, rc);
02559         } else {
02560                 if (memcmp(sf->sf_uuid, es->s_uuid, 16) != 0) {
02561                         struct obd_uuid *old_uuid;
02562                         struct obd_uuid *new_uuid;
02563 
02564                         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(old_uuid);
02565                         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(new_uuid);
02566                         if (old_uuid == NULL || new_uuid == NULL) {
02567                                 CERROR("%.16s: UUID has been changed, but"
02568                                        "failed to allocate RAM for report\n",
02569                                        LDISKFS_SB(sb)->s_es->s_volume_name);
02570                         } else {
02571                                 class_uuid_unparse(sf->sf_uuid, old_uuid);
02572                                 class_uuid_unparse(es->s_uuid, new_uuid);
02573                                 CERROR("%.16s: UUID has been changed from "
02574                                        "%s to %s\n",
02575                                        LDISKFS_SB(sb)->s_es->s_volume_name,
02576                                        old_uuid->uuid, new_uuid->uuid);
02577                         }
02578                         osd_scrub_file_reset(scrub, es->s_uuid,SF_INCONSISTENT);
02579                         dirty = true;
02580                         restored = true;
02581                         if (old_uuid != NULL)
02582                                 OBD_FREE_PTR(old_uuid);
02583                         if (new_uuid != NULL)
02584                                 OBD_FREE_PTR(new_uuid);
02585                 } else if (sf->sf_status == SS_SCANNING) {
02586                         sf->sf_status = SS_CRASHED;
02587                         dirty = true;
02588                 }
02589         }
02590 
02591         if (sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint != 0)
02592                 scrub->os_pos_current = sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint + 1;
02593         else
02594                 scrub->os_pos_current = LDISKFS_FIRST_INO(sb) + 1;
02595 
02596         if (dirty) {
02597                 rc = osd_scrub_file_store(scrub);
02598                 if (rc != 0)
02599                         GOTO(cleanup_inode, rc);
02600         }
02601 
02602         /* Initialize OI files. */
02603         rc = osd_oi_init(info, dev, restored);
02604         if (rc < 0)
02605                 GOTO(cleanup_inode, rc);
02606 
02607         rc = osd_initial_OI_scrub(info, dev);
02608         if (rc != 0)
02609                 GOTO(cleanup_oi, rc);
02610 
02611         if (sf->sf_flags & SF_UPGRADE ||
02612             !(sf->sf_internal_flags & SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID ||
02613               sf->sf_success_count > 0)) {
02614                 dev->od_igif_inoi = 0;
02615                 dev->od_check_ff = dev->od_is_ost;
02616         } else {
02617                 dev->od_igif_inoi = 1;
02618                 dev->od_check_ff = 0;
02619         }
02620 
02621         if (sf->sf_flags & SF_INCONSISTENT)
02622                 /* The 'od_igif_inoi' will be set under the
02623                  * following cases:
02624                  * 1) new created system, or
02625                  * 2) restored from file-level backup, or
02626                  * 3) the upgrading completed.
02627                  *
02628                  * The 'od_igif_inoi' may be cleared by OI scrub
02629                  * later if found that the system is upgrading. */
02630                 dev->od_igif_inoi = 1;
02631 
02632         if (!dev->od_noscrub &&
02633             ((sf->sf_status == SS_PAUSED) ||
02634              (sf->sf_status == SS_CRASHED &&
02635               sf->sf_flags & (SF_RECREATED | SF_INCONSISTENT |
02636                               SF_UPGRADE | SF_AUTO)) ||
02637              (sf->sf_status == SS_INIT &&
02638               sf->sf_flags & (SF_RECREATED | SF_INCONSISTENT |
02639                               SF_UPGRADE))))
02640                 rc = osd_scrub_start(dev, SS_AUTO_FULL);
02641 
02642         if (rc != 0)
02643                 GOTO(cleanup_oi, rc);
02644 
02645         /* it is possible that dcache entries may keep objects after they are
02646          * deleted by OSD. While it looks safe this can cause object data to
02647          * stay until umount causing failures in tests calculating free space,
02648          * e.g. replay-ost-single. Since those dcache entries are not used
02649          * anymore let's just free them after use here */
02650         shrink_dcache_sb(sb);
02651 
02652         RETURN(0);
02653 cleanup_oi:
02654         osd_oi_fini(info, dev);
02655 cleanup_inode:
02656         iput(scrub->os_inode);
02657         scrub->os_inode = NULL;
02658 
02659         return rc;
02660 }
02661 
02662 void osd_scrub_cleanup(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *dev)
02663 {
02664         struct osd_scrub *scrub = &dev->od_scrub;
02665 
02666         LASSERT(dev->od_otable_it == NULL);
02667 
02668         if (scrub->os_inode != NULL) {
02669                 osd_scrub_stop(dev);
02670                 iput(scrub->os_inode);
02671                 scrub->os_inode = NULL;
02672         }
02673         if (dev->od_oi_table != NULL)
02674                 osd_oi_fini(osd_oti_get(env), dev);
02675 }
02676 
02677 /* object table based iteration APIs */
02678 
02679 static struct dt_it *osd_otable_it_init(const struct lu_env *env,
02680                                        struct dt_object *dt, __u32 attr)
02681 {
02682         enum dt_otable_it_flags flags = attr >> DT_OTABLE_IT_FLAGS_SHIFT;
02683         enum dt_otable_it_valid valid = attr & ~DT_OTABLE_IT_FLAGS_MASK;
02684         struct osd_device      *dev   = osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
02685         struct osd_scrub       *scrub = &dev->od_scrub;
02686         struct osd_otable_it   *it;
02687         __u32                   start = 0;
02688         int                     rc;
02689         ENTRY;
02690 
02691         /* od_otable_mutex: prevent curcurrent init/fini */
02692         mutex_lock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02693         if (dev->od_otable_it != NULL)
02694                 GOTO(out, it = ERR_PTR(-EALREADY));
02695 
02696         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(it);
02697         if (it == NULL)
02698                 GOTO(out, it = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
02699 
02700         dev->od_otable_it = it;
02701         it->ooi_dev = dev;
02702         it->ooi_cache.ooc_consumer_idx = -1;
02703         if (flags & DOIF_OUTUSED)
02704                 it->ooi_used_outside = 1;
02705 
02706         if (flags & DOIF_RESET)
02707                 start |= SS_RESET;
02708 
02709         if (valid & DOIV_ERROR_HANDLE) {
02710                 if (flags & DOIF_FAILOUT)
02711                         start |= SS_SET_FAILOUT;
02712                 else
02713                         start |= SS_CLEAR_FAILOUT;
02714         }
02715 
02716         if (valid & DOIV_DRYRUN) {
02717                 if (flags & DOIF_DRYRUN)
02718                         start |= SS_SET_DRYRUN;
02719                 else
02720                         start |= SS_CLEAR_DRYRUN;
02721         }
02722 
02723         rc = do_osd_scrub_start(dev, start & ~SS_AUTO_PARTIAL);
02724         if (rc < 0 && rc != -EALREADY) {
02725                 dev->od_otable_it = NULL;
02726                 OBD_FREE_PTR(it);
02727                 GOTO(out, it = ERR_PTR(rc));
02728         }
02729 
02730         it->ooi_cache.ooc_pos_preload = scrub->os_pos_current;
02731 
02732         GOTO(out, it);
02733 
02734 out:
02735         mutex_unlock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02736         return (struct dt_it *)it;
02737 }
02738 
02739 static void osd_otable_it_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
02740 {
02741         struct osd_otable_it *it  = (struct osd_otable_it *)di;
02742         struct osd_device    *dev = it->ooi_dev;
02743 
02744         /* od_otable_mutex: prevent curcurrent init/fini */
02745         mutex_lock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02746         do_osd_scrub_stop(&dev->od_scrub);
02747         LASSERT(dev->od_otable_it == it);
02748 
02749         dev->od_otable_it = NULL;
02750         mutex_unlock(&dev->od_otable_mutex);
02751         OBD_FREE_PTR(it);
02752 }
02753 
02754 static int osd_otable_it_get(const struct lu_env *env,
02755                              struct dt_it *di, const struct dt_key *key)
02756 {
02757         return 0;
02758 }
02759 
02760 static void osd_otable_it_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
02761 {
02762 }
02763 
02764 static inline int
02765 osd_otable_it_wakeup(struct osd_scrub *scrub, struct osd_otable_it *it)
02766 {
02767         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02768         if (it->ooi_cache.ooc_pos_preload < scrub->os_pos_current ||
02769             scrub->os_waiting ||
02770             !thread_is_running(&scrub->os_thread))
02771                 it->ooi_waiting = 0;
02772         else
02773                 it->ooi_waiting = 1;
02774         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02775 
02776         return !it->ooi_waiting;
02777 }
02778 
02779 static int osd_otable_it_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
02780 {
02781         struct osd_otable_it    *it     = (struct osd_otable_it *)di;
02782         struct osd_device       *dev    = it->ooi_dev;
02783         struct osd_scrub        *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
02784         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc    = &it->ooi_cache;
02785         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
02786         struct l_wait_info       lwi    = { 0 };
02787         int                      rc;
02788         ENTRY;
02789 
02790         LASSERT(it->ooi_user_ready);
02791 
02792 again:
02793         if (!thread_is_running(thread) && !it->ooi_used_outside)
02794                 RETURN(1);
02795 
02796         if (ooc->ooc_cached_items > 0) {
02797                 ooc->ooc_cached_items--;
02798                 ooc->ooc_consumer_idx = (ooc->ooc_consumer_idx + 1) &
02799                                         ~OSD_OTABLE_IT_CACHE_MASK;
02800                 RETURN(0);
02801         }
02802 
02803         if (it->ooi_all_cached) {
02804                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
02805                              !thread_is_running(thread),
02806                              &lwi);
02807                 RETURN(1);
02808         }
02809 
02810         if (scrub->os_waiting && osd_scrub_has_window(scrub, ooc)) {
02811                 spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02812                 scrub->os_waiting = 0;
02813                 wake_up_all(&scrub->os_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
02814                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02815         }
02816 
02817         if (it->ooi_cache.ooc_pos_preload >= scrub->os_pos_current)
02818                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
02819                              osd_otable_it_wakeup(scrub, it),
02820                              &lwi);
02821 
02822         if (!thread_is_running(thread) && !it->ooi_used_outside)
02823                 RETURN(1);
02824 
02825         rc = osd_otable_it_preload(env, it);
02826         if (rc >= 0)
02827                 goto again;
02828 
02829         RETURN(rc);
02830 }
02831 
02832 static struct dt_key *osd_otable_it_key(const struct lu_env *env,
02833                                         const struct dt_it *di)
02834 {
02835         return NULL;
02836 }
02837 
02838 static int osd_otable_it_key_size(const struct lu_env *env,
02839                                   const struct dt_it *di)
02840 {
02841         return sizeof(__u64);
02842 }
02843 
02844 static int osd_otable_it_rec(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
02845                              struct dt_rec *rec, __u32 attr)
02846 {
02847         struct osd_otable_it    *it  = (struct osd_otable_it *)di;
02848         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc = &it->ooi_cache;
02849 
02850         *(struct lu_fid *)rec = ooc->ooc_cache[ooc->ooc_consumer_idx].oic_fid;
02851 
02852         /* Filter out Invald FID already. */
02853         LASSERTF(fid_is_sane((struct lu_fid *)rec),
02854                  "Invalid FID "DFID", p_idx = %d, c_idx = %d\n",
02855                  PFID((struct lu_fid *)rec),
02856                  ooc->ooc_producer_idx, ooc->ooc_consumer_idx);
02857 
02858         return 0;
02859 }
02860 
02861 static __u64 osd_otable_it_store(const struct lu_env *env,
02862                                  const struct dt_it *di)
02863 {
02864         struct osd_otable_it    *it  = (struct osd_otable_it *)di;
02865         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc = &it->ooi_cache;
02866         __u64                    hash;
02867 
02868         if (it->ooi_user_ready && ooc->ooc_consumer_idx != -1)
02869                 hash = ooc->ooc_cache[ooc->ooc_consumer_idx].oic_lid.oii_ino;
02870         else
02871                 hash = ooc->ooc_pos_preload;
02872         return hash;
02873 }
02874 
02878 static int osd_otable_it_load(const struct lu_env *env,
02879                               const struct dt_it *di, __u64 hash)
02880 {
02881         struct osd_otable_it    *it    = (struct osd_otable_it *)di;
02882         struct osd_device       *dev   = it->ooi_dev;
02883         struct osd_otable_cache *ooc   = &it->ooi_cache;
02884         struct osd_scrub        *scrub = &dev->od_scrub;
02885         int                      rc;
02886         ENTRY;
02887 
02888         /* Forbid to set iteration position after iteration started. */
02889         if (it->ooi_user_ready)
02890                 RETURN(-EPERM);
02891 
02892         if (hash > OSD_OTABLE_MAX_HASH)
02893                 hash = OSD_OTABLE_MAX_HASH;
02894 
02895         ooc->ooc_pos_preload = hash;
02896         if (ooc->ooc_pos_preload <= LDISKFS_FIRST_INO(osd_sb(dev)))
02897                 ooc->ooc_pos_preload = LDISKFS_FIRST_INO(osd_sb(dev)) + 1;
02898 
02899         it->ooi_user_ready = 1;
02900         if (!scrub->os_full_speed)
02901                 wake_up_all(&scrub->os_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
02902 
02903         /* Unplug OSD layer iteration by the first next() call. */
02904         rc = osd_otable_it_next(env, (struct dt_it *)it);
02905 
02906         RETURN(rc);
02907 }
02908 
02909 static int osd_otable_it_key_rec(const struct lu_env *env,
02910                                  const struct dt_it *di, void *key_rec)
02911 {
02912         return 0;
02913 }

02915 const struct dt_index_operations osd_otable_ops = {
02916         .dio_it = {
02917                 .init     = osd_otable_it_init,
02918                 .fini     = osd_otable_it_fini,
02919                 .get      = osd_otable_it_get,
02920                 .put      = osd_otable_it_put,
02921                 .next     = osd_otable_it_next,
02922                 .key      = osd_otable_it_key,
02923                 .key_size = osd_otable_it_key_size,
02924                 .rec      = osd_otable_it_rec,
02925                 .store    = osd_otable_it_store,
02926                 .load     = osd_otable_it_load,
02927                 .key_rec  = osd_otable_it_key_rec,
02928         }
02929 };
02930 
02931 /* high priority inconsistent items list APIs */
02932 
02933 #define SCRUB_BAD_OIMAP_DECAY_INTERVAL  60
02934 
02935 int osd_oii_insert(struct osd_device *dev, struct osd_idmap_cache *oic,
02936                    int insert)
02937 {
02938         struct osd_inconsistent_item *oii;
02939         struct osd_scrub             *scrub  = &dev->od_scrub;
02940         struct ptlrpc_thread         *thread = &scrub->os_thread;
02941         int                           wakeup = 0;
02942         ENTRY;
02943 
02944         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oii);
02945         if (unlikely(oii == NULL))
02946                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02947 
02948         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oii->oii_list);
02949         oii->oii_cache = *oic;
02950         oii->oii_insert = insert;
02951 
02952         if (scrub->os_partial_scan) {
02953                 __u64 now = cfs_time_current_sec();
02954 
02955                 /* If there haven't been errors in a long time,
02956                  * decay old count until either the errors are
02957                  * gone or we reach the current interval. */
02958                 while (unlikely(scrub->os_bad_oimap_count > 0 &&
02959                                 scrub->os_bad_oimap_time +
02960                                 SCRUB_BAD_OIMAP_DECAY_INTERVAL < now)) {
02961                         scrub->os_bad_oimap_count >>= 1;
02962                         scrub->os_bad_oimap_time +=
02963                                 SCRUB_BAD_OIMAP_DECAY_INTERVAL;
02964                 }
02965 
02966                 scrub->os_bad_oimap_time = now;
02967                 if (++scrub->os_bad_oimap_count >
02968                     dev->od_full_scrub_threshold_rate)
02969                         scrub->os_full_scrub = 1;
02970         }
02971 
02972         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02973         if (unlikely(!thread_is_running(thread))) {
02974                 spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02975                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oii);
02976                 RETURN(-EAGAIN);
02977         }
02978 
02979         if (list_empty(&scrub->os_inconsistent_items))
02980                 wakeup = 1;
02981         list_add_tail(&oii->oii_list, &scrub->os_inconsistent_items);
02982         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
02983 
02984         if (wakeup != 0)
02985                 wake_up_all(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
02986 
02987         RETURN(0);
02988 }
02989 
02990 int osd_oii_lookup(struct osd_device *dev, const struct lu_fid *fid,
02991                    struct osd_inode_id *id)
02992 {
02993         struct osd_scrub             *scrub = &dev->od_scrub;
02994         struct osd_inconsistent_item *oii;
02995         ENTRY;
02996 
02997         spin_lock(&scrub->os_lock);
02998         list_for_each_entry(oii, &scrub->os_inconsistent_items, oii_list) {
02999                 if (lu_fid_eq(fid, &oii->oii_cache.oic_fid)) {
03000                         *id = oii->oii_cache.oic_lid;
03001                         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
03002                         RETURN(0);
03003                 }
03004         }
03005         spin_unlock(&scrub->os_lock);
03006 
03007         RETURN(-ENOENT);
03008 }

03010 /* OI scrub dump */
03011 
03012 static const char *scrub_status_names[] = {
03013         "init",
03014         "scanning",
03015         "completed",
03016         "failed",
03017         "stopped",
03018         "paused",
03019         "crashed",
03020         NULL
03021 };
03022 
03023 static const char *scrub_flags_names[] = {
03024         "recreated",
03025         "inconsistent",
03026         "auto",
03027         "upgrade",
03028         NULL
03029 };
03030 
03031 static const char *scrub_param_names[] = {
03032         "failout",
03033         "dryrun",
03034         NULL
03035 };
03036 
03037 static void scrub_bits_dump(struct seq_file *m, int bits, const char *names[],
03038                             const char *prefix)
03039 {
03040         int flag;
03041         int i;
03042 
03043         seq_printf(m, "%s:%c", prefix, bits != 0 ? ' ' : '\n');
03044 
03045         for (i = 0, flag = 1; bits != 0; i++, flag = 1 << i) {
03046                 if (flag & bits) {
03047                         bits &= ~flag;
03048                         seq_printf(m, "%s%c", names[i],
03049                                    bits != 0 ? ',' : '\n');
03050                 }
03051         }
03052 }
03053 
03054 static void scrub_time_dump(struct seq_file *m, __u64 time, const char *prefix)
03055 {
03056         if (time != 0)
03057                 seq_printf(m, "%s: "LPU64" seconds\n", prefix,
03058                            cfs_time_current_sec() - time);
03059         else
03060                 seq_printf(m, "%s: N/A\n", prefix);
03061 }
03062 
03063 static void scrub_pos_dump(struct seq_file *m, __u64 pos, const char *prefix)
03064 {
03065         if (pos != 0)
03066                 seq_printf(m, "%s: "LPU64"\n", prefix, pos);
03067         else
03068                 seq_printf(m, "%s: N/A\n", prefix);
03069 }
03070 
03071 int osd_scrub_dump(struct seq_file *m, struct osd_device *dev)
03072 {
03073         struct osd_scrub  *scrub   = &dev->od_scrub;
03074         struct scrub_file *sf      = &scrub->os_file;
03075         __u64              checked;
03076         __u64              speed;
03077 
03078         down_read(&scrub->os_rwsem);
03079         seq_printf(m, "name: OI_scrub\n"
03080                    "magic: 0x%x\n"
03081                    "oi_files: %d\n"
03082                    "status: %s\n",
03083                    sf->sf_magic, (int)sf->sf_oi_count,
03084                    scrub_status_names[sf->sf_status]);
03085 
03086         scrub_bits_dump(m, sf->sf_flags, scrub_flags_names, "flags");
03087 
03088         scrub_bits_dump(m, sf->sf_param, scrub_param_names, "param");
03089 
03090         scrub_time_dump(m, sf->sf_time_last_complete,
03091                         "time_since_last_completed");
03092 
03093         scrub_time_dump(m, sf->sf_time_latest_start,
03094                         "time_since_latest_start");
03095 
03096         scrub_time_dump(m, sf->sf_time_last_checkpoint,
03097                         "time_since_last_checkpoint");
03098 
03099         scrub_pos_dump(m, sf->sf_pos_latest_start,
03100                         "latest_start_position");
03101 
03102         scrub_pos_dump(m, sf->sf_pos_last_checkpoint,
03103                         "last_checkpoint_position");
03104 
03105         scrub_pos_dump(m, sf->sf_pos_first_inconsistent,
03106                         "first_failure_position");
03107 
03108         checked = sf->sf_items_checked + scrub->os_new_checked;
03109         seq_printf(m, "checked: "LPU64"\n"
03110                    "updated: "LPU64"\n"
03111                    "failed: "LPU64"\n"
03112                    "prior_updated: "LPU64"\n"
03113                    "noscrub: "LPU64"\n"
03114                    "igif: "LPU64"\n"
03115                    "success_count: %u\n",
03116                    checked, sf->sf_items_updated, sf->sf_items_failed,
03117                    sf->sf_items_updated_prior, sf->sf_items_noscrub,
03118                    sf->sf_items_igif, sf->sf_success_count);
03119 
03120         speed = checked;
03121         if (thread_is_running(&scrub->os_thread)) {
03122                 cfs_duration_t duration = cfs_time_current() -
03123                                           scrub->os_time_last_checkpoint;
03124                 __u64 new_checked = msecs_to_jiffies(scrub->os_new_checked *
03125                                                      MSEC_PER_SEC);
03126                 __u32 rtime = sf->sf_run_time +
03127                               cfs_duration_sec(duration + HALF_SEC);
03128 
03129                 if (duration != 0)
03130                         do_div(new_checked, duration);
03131                 if (rtime != 0)
03132                         do_div(speed, rtime);
03133                 seq_printf(m, "run_time: %u seconds\n"
03134                            "average_speed: "LPU64" objects/sec\n"
03135                            "real-time_speed: "LPU64" objects/sec\n"
03136                            "current_position: %u\n"
03137                            "lf_scanned: "LPU64"\n"
03138                            "lf_repaired: "LPU64"\n"
03139                            "lf_failed: "LPU64"\n",
03140                            rtime, speed, new_checked, scrub->os_pos_current,
03141                            scrub->os_lf_scanned, scrub->os_lf_repaired,
03142                            scrub->os_lf_failed);
03143         } else {
03144                 if (sf->sf_run_time != 0)
03145                         do_div(speed, sf->sf_run_time);
03146                 seq_printf(m, "run_time: %u seconds\n"
03147                            "average_speed: "LPU64" objects/sec\n"
03148                            "real-time_speed: N/A\n"
03149                            "current_position: N/A\n"
03150                            "lf_scanned: "LPU64"\n"
03151                            "lf_repaired: "LPU64"\n"
03152                            "lf_failed: "LPU64"\n",
03153                            sf->sf_run_time, speed, scrub->os_lf_scanned,
03154                            scrub->os_lf_repaired, scrub->os_lf_failed);
03155         }
03156 
03157         up_read(&scrub->os_rwsem);
03158         return 0;
03159 }
